trans: n.  打印机；印刷工；印花工

sentences.english: a laser printer
sentences.chinese: 激光打印机

sentences.english: a colour printer
sentences.chinese: 彩色打印机

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 打印机；印刷工；印花工
detailed_translations.english: a machine which is connected to a computer and can make a printed record of computer information

name: recover
trans: vt. 恢复；弥补；重新获得
vi. 恢复；胜诉；重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

sentences.english: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

detailed_translations.english: not exactly

sentences.english: a rubbish bin
sentences.chinese: 垃圾桶

detailed_translations.english: food, paper etc that is no longer needed and has been thrown away

sentences.english: Manchester United supporters
sentences.chinese: 曼彻斯特联队的支持者

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports a particular person, group, or plan

name: sustainable
trans: adj. 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

name: tenant
trans: n. 承租人；房客；佃户；居住者
vt. 租借（常用于被动语态）

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: trial
trans: n. 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机； 触发器；制滑机

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: absence
trans: n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

sentences.english: ‘Do you let your kids travel alone at night?’ ‘Absolutely not!’
sentences.chinese: “你会让孩子们晚上单独外出吗？”“当然不行！”

detailed_translations.english: used when you strongly disagree with someone or when you do not want someone to do something

name: adverse
trans: adj. 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: assistance
trans: n. 援助，帮助；辅助设备

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

name: attraction
trans: n. 吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

name: bound
trans: adj. 有义务的；必定的；受约束的；装有封面的

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: breast
trans: n. 乳房，胸部；胸怀；心情

sentences.english: These bras are specially designed for women with large breasts.
sentences.chinese: 这些胸罩专为乳房丰满的女性设计。

sentences.english: breast milk
sentences.chinese: 母乳

sentences.english: breast cancer
sentences.chinese: 乳腺癌

sentences.english: Dick cradled her photograph against his breast.
sentences.chinese: 迪克把她的照片轻轻拥在胸前。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby

name: compel
trans: vt. 强迫，迫使；强使发生

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: deadline
trans: n. 截止期限，最后期限

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: directly
trans: adv. 直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: epidemic
trans: n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: escape
trans: n. 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏
vi. 逃脱；避开；溜走；（气体，液体等）漏出；（未受伤或只受了一点伤害而）逃脱；声音（不自觉地）由…发出
vt. 逃避，避开，避免；被忘掉；被忽视

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: exert
trans: vt. 运用，发挥；施以影响

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝；消失；消灭；废止

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹
vt. 提取；取出；摘录；榨取

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

name: fashionable
trans: adj. 流行的；时髦的；上流社会的

sentences.english: Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下流行艳丽的色彩。

detailed_translations.english: popular, especially for a short period of time

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: indicator
trans: n. 指示器； 指示剂； 指示符；压力计

sentences.english: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.
sentences.chinese: 所有主要的经济指标都表明贸易情况正在改善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计
detailed_translations.english: something that can be regarded as a sign of something else

name: indispensable
trans: n. 不可缺少之物；必不可少的人
adj. 不可缺少的；绝对必要的；责无旁贷的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: interpreter
trans: n. 解释者；口译者；注释器

sentences.english: Speaking through an interpreter (= using an interpreter ), Ahmed said, ‘I’m very worried about my wife and children.’
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德通过口译者说:“我很担心我的妻子和孩子们。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: leisure
trans: adj. 空闲的；有闲的；业余的

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

sentences.english: Since earliest times, mankind has been fascinated by fire.
sentences.chinese: 人类自远古以来就对火很感兴趣。

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重要的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: all humans considered as a group

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: outdated
trans: v. 使过时（outdate的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: outdated teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 不合时宜的教学方法

sentences.english: a factory with outdated equipment
sentences.chinese: 设备陈旧的工厂

sentences.english: His writing style is now boring and outdated.
sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

sentences.english: She is young and physically fit.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻而且身体健康。

sentences.english: Do you find him physically attractive?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得他长得帅吗？

sentences.english: I felt physically sick at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 一想到那个我就觉得身体不舒服。

sentences.english: children who have been physically abused
sentences.chinese: 身体受到虐待的儿童

detailed_translations.english: in relation to your body rather than your mind or emotions

name: plus
trans: n. 正号，加号；好处；附加额

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

sentences.english: The story should act as a warning to other prospective buyers.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

detailed_translations.english: You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned

name: readily
trans: adv. 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: reject
trans: n. 被弃之物或人；次品
vt. 拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件；必需品

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: resistance
trans: n. 阻力；电阻；抵抗；反抗；抵抗力

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

name: risky
trans: adj. 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的

sentences.english: Doctors say it’s too risky to try and operate.
sentences.chinese: 医生说动手术风险太大。

sentences.english: Buying a secondhand car is a risky business .
sentences.chinese: 买二手汽车是有风险的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的
detailed_translations.english: involving a risk that something bad will happen

name: sensible
trans: n. 可感觉到的东西; 敏感的人;
adj. 明智的; 通情达理的; 合乎情理的; 意识到的，能感觉到的;

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

name: settle
trans: vi. 解决；定居；沉淀；下陷

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: significantly
trans: adv. 显著地；相当数量地

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: standardise
trans: vt. 使…符合标准；使…标准化；使…统一

name: standardize
trans: vt. 使标准化；用标准检验

sentences.english: Attempts to standardize English spelling have never been successful.
sentences.chinese: 统一英语拼写的尝试从未成功过。

sentences.english: standardized tests
sentences.chinese: 标准化测试

detailed_translations.english: to make all the things of one particular type the same as each other

name: strain
trans: n. 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘
vt. 拉紧；滥用；滤去；竭力

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: tap
trans: vt. 轻敲；轻打；装上嘴子

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: theatre
trans: n. 电影院，戏院；戏剧；阶梯式讲堂

sentences.english: an open-air theatre (= a theatre that is outside )
sentences.chinese: 露天剧场

sentences.english: the Mercury Theater
sentences.chinese: 水星剧院

detailed_translations.english: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed

name: theater
trans: n. 电影院，戏院，剧场；戏剧；手术室

sentences.english: It ushered in the new theater season.
sentences.chinese: 它预示了新的戏剧旺季的来临。

sentences.english: The theater emptied when the movie ended.
sentences.chinese: 电影结束了， 剧院里的人就走空了。

sentences.english: You know, like fencing, or theater or something.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，像是击剑，戏剧表演或什么的。

name: threshold
trans: n. 入口；门槛；开始；极限；临界值

sentences.english: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 她打开门，跨过门槛。

sentences.english: The creature is on the threshold of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这种生物已濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

sentences.english: upward pressure on bank interest rates
sentences.chinese: 针对银行利率的越来越大的压力

sentences.english: They climbed upward along the steep cliffs surrounding the village.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着环绕村庄的陡峭悬崖向上爬。

sentences.english: 'There,' said Jack, pointing upwards.
sentences.chinese: “那儿，”杰克往上指着说。

detailed_translations.english: increasing to a higher level
If someone moves or looks upward, they move or look up towards a higher place

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: weaken
trans: vt. 减少；使变弱；使变淡

sentences.english: Over the last two years the president’s position has weakened.
sentences.chinese: 过去两年来，总统的地位被削弱了。

sentences.english: Changes in policy have weakened the power of the trade unions.
sentences.chinese: 政策的变化削弱了工会的力量。

sentences.english: The absence of this witness has weakened the case against the accused.
sentences.chinese: 这名证人的缺席削弱了对被告的指控力度。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful
to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful

sentences.english: Other youngsters are not so lucky.
sentences.chinese: 其他的年轻人没有这么幸运。

detailed_translations.english: a child or young person

name: addicted
trans: v. 使…上瘾（addict的过去分词）
adj. 沉溺于某种（尤其是不良的）嗜好的；入了迷的，上了瘾的

sentences.english: Many of the women are addicted to heroin and cocaine.
sentences.chinese: 这些妇女中的很多吸食海洛因和可卡因成瘾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺于某种（尤其是不良的）嗜好的；入了迷的，上了瘾的
detailed_translations.english: unable to stop taking a harmful substance, especially a drug

name: adequate
trans: adj. 充足的；适当的；胜任的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: adversity
trans: n. 逆境；不幸；灾难；灾祸

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

name: altogether
trans: adv. 完全地；总共；总而言之

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

sentences.english: The door clicked shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 门在我身后咔嗒一声关上了。

sentences.english: Mother clicked her tongue (= made a short sound to show disapproval ) and sighed.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈咂咂嘴，叹了口气。

sentences.english: Edmund clicked his fingers (= made a short sound to get someone’s attention ) for John to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙弹了个响指示意约翰跟着他。

sentences.english: Vogel clicked his heels (= hit the heels of his shoes together ) and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 沃格尔咔嗒一声并拢脚跟，鞠了个躬。

sentences.english: Twist the lever and the gears click into place .
sentences.chinese: 转动变速杆，排挡就咔嗒一声到位了。

sentences.english: You can check your e-mail with a click of your mouse.
sentences.chinese: 通过鼠标的一点你就能查电子邮件。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound
Click is also a noun

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: comparison
trans: n. 比较；对照；比喻；比较关系

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: constitute
trans: vt. 组成，构成；建立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: context
trans: n. 环境；上下文；来龙去脉

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: convenience
trans: n. 便利；厕所；便利的事物

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

sentences.english: Remove the cores, and bake the apples for 40 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 去除果心，然后把苹果烤40分钟。

sentences.english: Debt is at the core of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 债务是问题的关键。

detailed_translations.english: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

sentences.english: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.
sentences.chinese: 他决定把余生奉献给科学研究。

detailed_translations.english: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

name: disadvantage
trans: n. 缺点；不利条件；损失

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

name: dispute
trans: vt. 辩论；怀疑；阻止；抗拒

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: downtown
trans: n. 市中心区；三分线以外

sentences.english: By day he worked downtown for American Standard.
sentences.chinese: 白天，他在市中心为美国标准公司工作。

sentences.english: ...an office in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: …芝加哥市中心的一间办公室。

sentences.english: ...in a large vacant area of the downtown.
sentences.chinese: …在市中心的一大块空地上。

detailed_translations.english: Downtown is also an adverb
Downtown places are in or toward the centre of a large town or city, where the stores and places of business are
Downtown is also a noun

name: endorse
trans: vt. 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: freshman
trans: n. 新手，生手；大学一年级学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 新手，生手；大学一年级学生
detailed_translations.english: a student in the first year of  high school  or university

name: harsh
trans: adj. 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: imagination
trans: n.  想象力；空想；幻想物

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想；曝光（衡量广告被显示的次数。打开一个带有该广告的网页，则该广告的impression 次数增加一次）

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: industrial
trans: n. 工业股票；工业工人
adj. 工业的，产业的；从事工业的；供工业用的；来自勤劳的

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的；有势力的

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: informal
trans: adj. 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的

sentences.english: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour

name: intensive
trans: adj. 加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: interpersonal
trans: adj. 人际的；人与人之间的

sentences.english: interpersonal skills
sentences.chinese: 人际交往技巧

sentences.english: interpersonal communication
sentences.chinese: 人际沟通

detailed_translations.chinese: 人与人之间的， 关于人与人之间关系的
detailed_translations.english: relating to relationships between people

name: intimacy
trans: n. 性行为；亲密；亲昵行为；隐私

sentences.english: She thought back over the intimacies they’d shared and the plans they’d made.
sentences.chinese: 她回想起他们之间曾经有过的亲密言行以及他们设想的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性行为；亲密；亲昵行为；隐私
detailed_translations.english: a state of having a close personal relationship with someone

name: intolerant
trans: adj. 无法忍受的；偏狭的

sentences.english: people who are intolerant of other people’s political beliefs
sentences.chinese: 不能容忍他人政治信仰的人

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as intolerant, you mean that they do not accept behaviour and opinions that are different from their own

name: irrigation
trans: n. 灌溉； 冲洗；冲洗法

sentences.english: Small blockages or collapses of the canal would choke the intricate irrigation networks.
sentences.chinese: 运河的小堵塞或倒塌都会阻塞整个负责的灌溉网络。

sentences.english: In the United States, by contrast, 41% goes for agriculture, almost all of it for irrigation.
sentences.chinese: 与之相比，美国全年41%的水投向了农业，并几乎全都用在了灌溉上。

sentences.english: Spray irrigation sprinkling water over land to be used for crops. often used to dispose of wastewater from sewage treatment plants.
sentences.chinese: 喷洒灌溉，喷灌把水喷洒于准备种植作物的土地上。常常使用经过污水厂处理过的废水。

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: observation
trans: n. 观察；监视；观察报告

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: ongoing
trans: adj. 不间断的，进行的；前进的

sentences.english: their ongoing search for a new director
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.english: ongoing negotiations
sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

name: outweigh
trans: vt. 比…重（在重量上）；比…重要；比…有价值

sentences.english: The advantages of this deal largely outweigh the disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这笔交易的利远大于弊。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing

name: panic
trans: adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: producer
trans: n. 制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器

sentences.english: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
sentences.chinese: …沙特阿拉伯，世界上最重要的石油生产国。

sentences.english: Hollywood producers and movie stars
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

name: profile
trans: n. 侧面；轮廓；外形；剖面；简况
vt. 描…的轮廓；扼要描述

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: publicity
trans: n. 宣传，宣扬；公开；广告；注意

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格；条件；限制；赋予资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: recognition
trans: n. 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: revolutionary
trans: adj. 革命的；旋转的；大变革的

sentences.english: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

detailed_translations.english: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

name: rigorous
trans: adj. 严格的，严厉的；严密的；严酷的

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

name: scheme
trans: n. 计划；组合；体制；诡计

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: shelter
trans: n. 庇护；避难所；遮盖物

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: slash
trans: n. 削减；斜线；猛砍；砍痕；沼泽低地
vt. 猛砍；鞭打；严厉批评；大幅度裁减或削减

sentences.english: Someone had slashed the tires.
sentences.chinese: 有人把轮胎割破了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 砍， 砍痕； 斜线号
detailed_translations.english: a line (/) used in writing to separate words, numbers, or letters

name: slide
trans: n. 滑动；幻灯片；滑梯；雪崩
vt. 滑动；使滑动；悄悄地迅速放置
vi. 滑动；滑落；不知不觉陷入

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

name: steady
trans: n. 关系固定的情侣；固定支架
adj. 稳定的；不变的；沉着的
vt. 使稳定；稳固；使坚定

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: stray
trans: n. 走失的家畜；流浪者
adj. 迷路的；离群的；偶遇的

sentences.english: This will limit the number of stray dogs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这将会减少流浪狗在这一区域的数量。

sentences.english: As for her personal safety, she said she isn't overly worried but does think about what a stray lunatic could do.
sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.english: Then let's say you get into horrible, disastrous debt and have to go begging to the government, like a sad little stray.
sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that is lost or has no home

name: subtle
trans: adj. 微妙的；精细的；敏感的；狡猾的；稀薄的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: supreme
trans: adj. 最高的；至高的；最重要的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

sentences.english: Much of this, she says, is due to increased urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 而这些，主要是由于不断增加的都市化造成的。

sentences.english: These diseases are now everywhere, driven as they are by universal forces, like urbanization and the globalization of unhealthy lifestyles.
sentences.chinese: 现在，在城市化和不健康生活方式的全球化等普遍因素的影响下，这些疾病无处不在。

sentences.english: Countries and regions all over the world face the challenge of urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 全球各地的国家和地区都面临城市化的挑战。

detailed_translations.english: Urbanization is the process of creating cities or towns in country areas

name: variable
trans: n.  变量；可变物，可变因素
adj. 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的， 畸变的

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: vocal
trans: adj. 歌唱的；声音的，有声的

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

sentences.english: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
sentences.chinese: 保护该地区野生生物的措施

sentences.english: the destruction of wildlife habitats
sentences.chinese: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

detailed_translations.english: animals and plants growing in natural conditions

name: accessible
trans: adj. 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

sentences.english: They own 200 acres of farmland.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥有200英亩农田。

sentences.english: a 200-acre wood
sentences.chinese: 一片200英亩的林地

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres

sentences.english: She helped him fight his drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 她帮助了他对抗自己的毒瘾。

detailed_translations.english: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

name: affluent
trans: adj. 富裕的；丰富的；流畅的

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: alike
trans: adv. 以同样的方式；类似于

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: analyst
trans: n. 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者

sentences.english: Political analysts expect the Conservatives to win.
sentences.chinese: 政治分析家预计保守党获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it

name: anxious
trans: adj. 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: badly
trans: adv. 非常，很；严重地，厉害地；恶劣地

sentences.english: The company has been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司的管理非常差。

sentences.english: He’s been limping badly ever since the skiing accident.
sentences.chinese: 出了那次滑雪事故以后，他的腿跛得很厉害。

sentences.english: We badly wanted to help, but there was nothing we could do.
sentences.chinese: 我们很想帮忙，可又无计可施。

sentences.english: He was beaten so badly that his brother didn’t recognize him.
sentences.chinese: 他被打得连他哥哥都认不出他了。

sentences.english: The school is badly in need of (=  very much needs  ) some new computers.
sentences.chinese: 学校急需一些新电脑。

sentences.english: Things started to go badly wrong (=  go wrong in a serious way  ) for Eric after he lost his job.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克失去工作以后，一切都很不如意。

detailed_translations.english: in an unsatisfactory or unsuccessful way

sentences.english: It helps point out some of the behavioral barriers you have in making better food choices.
sentences.chinese: 而且当你在选择更好的食物的时候它也可以帮助你指出一些行为障碍。

sentences.english: Both my mother and grandmother were diagnosed with depression. I saw more behavioral symptoms in them, but I knew they were taking medication and they seemed to have it under control.
sentences.chinese: 我的母亲和曾祖母都曾被诊断为抑郁症，在她们身上我见得更多的是行为的异常，但我知道她们也用药并且症状控制得似乎不错。

sentences.english: From behavioral quirks to brain cancer, researchers have looked for any health risks associated with cellphone radiation for years.
sentences.chinese: 从行为怪癖到脑癌，数年来研究人员一直在寻找与手机辐射有关的健康风险。

sentences.english: the biological functions of the body
sentences.chinese: 人体的生物机能

sentences.english: Depression is both biological and psychological.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

name: chapter
trans: n. 章，回；（俱乐部、协会等的）分会；人生或历史上的重要时期

sentences.english: Read Chapter 11 as your homework.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业是阅读第 11 章。

sentences.english: This chapter discusses power, and how people use it.
sentences.chinese: 这一章节讲权力，以及人们如何运用权力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts into which a book is divided

name: cling
trans: vi. 坚持，墨守；紧贴；附着

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

sentences.english: He pushed in the clutch and coasted to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 他踩下离合器，滑行了一会儿便停下来了。

detailed_translations.english: if a car or bicycle coasts, it moves without any effort from you or any power from the engine
the area where the land meets the sea

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念

trans: n. 皈依者；改变宗教信仰者
vt. 使转变；转换…；使…改变信仰
vi. 转变，变换；皈依；改变信仰

sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

trans: adv. 清楚地，当然；明确地，肯定地

sentences.chinese: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

trans: vt. 否定，否认；拒绝给予；拒绝…的要求

sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

sentences.chinese: 这儿的水有多深？

sentences.chinese: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the development of someone or something

name: discount

vi. 贴现；打折扣出售商品

sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

trans: adj. 不同的；多种多样的；变化多的

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

trans: adj. 动态的；动力的；动力学的；有活力的

sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的

something that causes action or change

trans: n. 东方人；（美国）东部地区的人
adj. 东方的；朝东的；东洋的

sentences.chinese: 岛的东岸

sentences.chinese: 英格兰东部的农民

sentences.chinese: 另一些人喜欢他们则是因为他们偏好于更有效的通信，不会错过一些重要的交谈和联系。

sentences.chinese: 与她为敌很危险。

sentences.english: Cats and dogs have always been natural enemies.
sentences.chinese: 猫和狗向来是天敌。

sentences.english: an old enemy of her father

sentences.english: the unforgettable sight of the president shaking hands with his sworn enemy
sentences.chinese: 董事长与其死敌握手的难忘情景

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wishthis on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是我的死对头，我也不愿看到他发生这样的事情。

sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

trans: adj. 课外的；业余的；婚外的

sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

name: fiscal
trans: adj. 会计的，财政的；国库的

sentences.chinese: 财政危机

sentences.chinese: 财政事务

sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

sentences.chinese: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯，旧称吉尔伯特群岛

sentences.chinese: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

vi. 合并；混合；组成公司

sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定他无罪。

sentences.chinese: 由陪审团进行审理的权利

name: lean

sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

trans: adv. 照字面地；逐字地；不夸张地；正确地；简直

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

name: mature

vt. 使…成熟；使…长成；慎重作出

sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: minority
trans: n. 少数民族；少数派；未成年
adj. 少数的；属于少数派的

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

name: organic
trans: adj.  有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的

sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

name: pace
trans: n. 一步；步速；步伐；速度

sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，盼望着早点回到家中。

sentences.english: Traffic slowed to a walking pace.
sentences.chinese: 车流速度减缓，犹如步行。

sentences.english: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

name: pill
trans: n. 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药
vt. 把…制成丸剂；使服用药丸；抢劫，掠夺（古语）

sentences.english: He has to take pills to control his blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 他必须服药控制血压。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sleeping pills"]}
sentences.chinese: 安眠药

sentences.english: a bottle of vitamin pills
sentences.chinese: 一瓶维生素片

detailed_translations.chinese: 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药

trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取

sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: conscious
trans: adj. 意识到的；故意的；神志清醒的

sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: consistent
trans: adj. 始终如一的，一致的；坚持的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

trans: adv. 一贯地；一致地；坚实地

sentences.english: Instead, we should be articulating guidelines that answer consistently the questions: Who should we support in the Middle East?
sentences.chinese: 而我们应该作为回答这一系列一致问题的清晰指向标。 例如，“在中东我们应该支持谁？”

sentences.english: The robe was held at the waist by a cord.
sentences.chinese: 在袍子腰处束了根细绳。

sentences.english: He pulled explosives and some tangled cord from his bag.
sentences.chinese: 他从他的包里掏出炸药和一些乱糟糟的绳子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of thick string or thin rope

name: correlate
trans: n. 相关物；相关联的人
vt. 使有相互关系；互相有关系

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: counsel
trans: n. 法律顾问；忠告；商议；讨论；决策

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

name: counsellor
trans: n. 顾问；参赞；辅导员（等于counselor）；律师；法律顾问

sentences.english: Are you seeing a counsellor?
sentences.chinese: 你是不是在看心理辅导员？

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to help and support people with problems

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

name: defeat
trans: n. 失败的事实；击败的行为
vt. 击败，战胜；挫败；使…失败

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: definition
trans: n. 定义； 清晰度；解说

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

name: desert
trans: n. 沙漠；荒原；应得的赏罚
adj. 沙漠的；荒凉的；不毛的

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

trans: n. 开发者； 显影剂

sentences.chinese: 佛罗里达州的一家房地产开发公司

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that makes money by buying land and then building houses, factories etc on it

sentences.english: carbon/sulphur dioxide
sentences.chinese: 二氧化碳／硫

detailed_translations.english: a chemical compound that contains two atoms of oxygen and one atom of another chemical element

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 有特色的，与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: doll
trans: n. 洋娃娃；玩偶；无头脑的美丽女人
vt. 把…打扮得花枝招展

sentences.english: a small wooden doll
sentences.chinese: 一个小木玩偶

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋娃娃；玩偶；无头脑的美丽女人
detailed_translations.english: a child’s toy that looks like a small person or baby

sentences.english: City dwellers suffer higher pollution levels.
sentences.chinese: 城市居民承受的污染程度更严重。

detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

sentences.english: If you need to remove an agent you will have to do it by a process of elimination.
sentences.chinese: 如果您需要删除代理，将必须通过消除进程的方式进行此工作。

sentences.english: I recommend that you be relentless in the elimination of the backlog of defects and feature enhancements.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你在消除积压的缺陷和不断膨胀的特征时毫不留情。

sentences.english: In all, the new president selected 150 individual programs for cuts or elimination.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之,新的总统150个人项目选择削减或者消除。

detailed_translations.english: the removal or destruction of something

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: exact
trans: adj. 准确的，精密的；精确的

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: exploit
trans: vt. 开发，开拓；剥削；开采

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: fellow
trans: n. 家伙；朋友；同事；会员
adj. 同伴的，同事的；同道的
vt. 使…与另一个对等；使…与另一个匹敌

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

trans: vt. （乘渡船）渡过；用渡船运送；空运

sentences.english: They had recrossed the River Gambia by ferry.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘船又一次渡过了冈比亚河。

sentences.english: The ship was used to ferry supplies to Russia during the war.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船在战时被用来往俄罗斯 运送补给。

to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

name: fertilizer
trans: n.  肥料；受精媒介物；促进发展者

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

sentences.english: He questioned McNeil’s fitness for high office.
sentences.chinese: 他质疑麦克尼尔是否适合身居高位。

sentences.english: Running marathons requires a high level of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑马拉松需要身体十分强健。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which someone or something is suitable or good enough for a particular situation or purpose

name: formal
trans: n. 正式的社交活动；夜礼服
adj. 正式的；拘谨的；有条理的

sentences.english: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.chinese: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.english: a formal agreement between the countries
sentences.chinese: 两国间的正式协议

sentences.english: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.chinese: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

detailed_translations.english: made or done officially or publicly

sentences.english: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.english: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.english: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

name: hacker
trans: n. 电脑黑客，企图不法侵入他人电脑系统的人

sentences.english: A hacker had managed to get into the system.
sentences.chinese: 一个黑客设法侵入了系统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 电脑黑客，企图不法侵入他人电脑系统的人

name: hang
trans: vt. 悬挂，垂下；装饰；绞死；使悬而未决
vi. 悬着，垂下；被绞死；悬而不决

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: historic
trans: adj. 有历史意义的；历史上著名的

sentences.chinese: 具有历史意义的世界领导人会议

sentences.english: ‘It is a historic moment ,’ he told journalists.
sentences.chinese: “那是历史性的一刻。”他告诉新闻记者。

detailed_translations.english: a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history

trans: adv. 历史上地；从历史观点上说

sentences.english: And historically they acted with that sense of stewardship in mind, thinking of what was appropriate for the whole system and not simply for their firm.
sentences.chinese: 而且在历史上，他们也在心目中带有那种使命感，思考的是什么对这个社会是最好的，不仅仅是对自己的公司。

sentences.english: After all, historically, the two nations have been enemies.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟在历史上，两个国家曾经是敌人。

sentences.english: Because historically, we have not defined marriage in our constitution.
sentences.chinese: 因为历史上我们从未在宪法中给婚姻下过定义。

name: ideology
trans: n. 意识形态；思想意识；观念学

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

trans: adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的

sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: inefficient
trans: adj. 无效率的，效率低的；无能的

sentences.english: an inefficient use of resources
sentences.chinese: 资源的浪费

sentences.english: Local government was inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府效率低下。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效率的，效率低的；无能的
detailed_translations.english: not using time, money, energy etc in the best way

name: innovate
trans: vt. 改变；创立；创始；引人

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

sentences.english: One possible interpretation is that they want you to resign.
sentences.chinese: 一种可能的解释是，他们想要你辞职。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to put an accurate interpretation on (= explain ) the survey results.
sentences.chinese: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。

sentences.english: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation (= able to be understood or explained in different ways ).
sentences.chinese: 作者这句话的确切含义可有各种理解。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc

name: intuitive
trans: adj. 直觉的；凭直觉获知的

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

sentences.english: ...an attempt to get U.S. legislators to change the system.
sentences.chinese: …让美国立法者改变体制的一次努力。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has the power to make laws or belongs to an institution that makes laws

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的
n. 海运业；舰队；水兵；（海军）士兵或军官

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: migrant
trans: n. 候鸟；移居者；随季节迁移的民工

sentences.english: The government divides asylum seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.
sentences.chinese: 政府将寻求政治庇护的人划分为经济移民和真正的难民。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移居者， 移民； 候鸟， 迁移动物
detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: moderate
trans: adj. 稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
