to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: modest
trans: adj. 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country

name: municipal
trans: adj. 市政的，市的；地方自治的

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

name: nationwide
trans: adj. 全国范围的；全国性的

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country
Nationwide is also an adverb

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: echo
trans: vi. 随声附和；发出回声

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

sentences.english: Sometimes you have to sacrifice efficiency for effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你需要牺牲效率来达到效果。

sentences.english: However, its viability and effectiveness still have to be established.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它的有效性和可行性尚有待验证。

sentences.english: So, how do you manage and measure the effectiveness of your IT governance solution for your business?
sentences.chinese: 那么，您如何管理并度量面向您的企业的 IT 治理解决方案的有效性呢？

name: eligible
trans: n. 合格者；适任者；有资格者
adj. 合格的，合适的；符合条件的；有资格当选的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: enforce
trans: vt. 实施，执行；强迫，强制

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: esteem
trans: vt. 尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

name: fancy
trans: adj. 想象的；奇特的；昂贵的；精选的
vt. 想象；喜爱；设想；自负

sentences.english: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
to like or want something, or want to do something

name: file
trans: n. 文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀
vt. 提出；锉；琢磨；把…归档
vi. 列队行进；用锉刀锉

sentences.english: We will keep your details on file (= store them for later use ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.english: The contracts are filed alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject
to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

sentences.english: After all, your competitors are financially rational.
sentences.chinese: 至少你的对手财政上是理性的。

sentences.english: And you have to find a way to support yourself financially while you follow your passion.
sentences.chinese: 并且当你跟着你的激情走时，你必须找到一个办法在财政上支持你自己。

sentences.english: And I know it at Princeton, when you came, the Steve Forbes decided to no longer support the university financially. There have been protests at some of your talks.
sentences.chinese: 我知道当您刚刚来到普林斯顿大学的时候，福布斯集团决定不再支持,大学的财政开支，那时，有一些人,在您的讲座上抗议。

name: formulate
trans: vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

name: foster
trans: vt. 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: gallery
trans: n. 画廊；走廊；旁听席；地道
vt. 在…修建走廊；在…挖地道

sentences.english: The bright modern painting stares out at you in the otherwise conservative gallery.
sentences.chinese: 有些古典派画廊也会陈列出明亮色彩的现代派绘画。

sentences.english: Statement and portrait together form a single image of a thinker. (See the interactive gallery, “Why Philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 陈述和肖像一起构成了一位思想家的独有影像。 （参见互动画廊，“何为哲学？”）

sentences.english: Whether you just want to browse our huge image gallery or want to share your personal photos with others, this is the site for you!
sentences.chinese: 无论你是想要浏览我们众多的画廊图片还是想要和其他人分享你的个人照片,这个网站绝对对你的味口。

detailed_translations.english: a small privately owned shop or studio where you can see and buy pieces of art

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: hesitant
trans: adj. 迟疑的；踌躇的；犹豫不定的

sentences.english: Gail gave me a hesitant little smile.
sentences.chinese: 盖尔迟疑地对我微微一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟疑的；踌躇的；犹豫不定的
detailed_translations.english: uncertain about what to do or say because you are nervous or unwilling

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

sentences.english: We hooked the trailer to the back of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我们把拖车挂在汽车尾部。

sentences.english: a dress that hooks at the back
sentences.chinese: 从后背用钩扣的连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: to fasten or hang sth on sth else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way

name: illegal
trans: n. 非法移民，非法劳工
adj.  非法的；违法的；违反规则的

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

name: illiterate
trans: adj. 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 阐明，说明；照亮；使灿烂；用灯装饰

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: illustrate
trans: vt. 阐明，举例说明；图解

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: incredibly
trans: adv. 难以置信地；非常地

sentences.english: Nicotine is incredibly addictive.
sentences.chinese: 尼古丁很容易让人上瘾。

detailed_translations.english: extremely

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: indirect
trans: adj. 间接的；迂回的；非直截了当的

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.english: The indirect effects of climate change may be profound.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化造成的间接影响可能是深远的。

sentences.english: George’s comments were an indirect way of blaming me.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

detailed_translations.english: not directly caused by something

name: inertia
trans: n.  惯性；惰性，迟钝；不活动

sentences.english: Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 飞机靠惯性着陆。

sentences.english: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

name: inevitably
trans: adv. 不可避免地；必然地

sentences.english: The decision will inevitably lead to political tensions.
sentences.chinese: 该决定必然导致政治局势的紧张。

sentences.english: Inevitably, the situation did not please everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况必定不能让所有人都感到满意。

detailed_translations.english: used for saying that something is certain to happen and cannot be avoided

name: inferior
trans: adj. 差的；自卑的；下级的，下等的

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

name: ingenuity
trans: n. 心灵手巧，独创性；精巧；精巧的装置
n. 西门子公司将其品牌宣言“Ingenuity for life” 诠释为“博大精深 同心致远”

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.english: Sitting with my IV drip, I like to think about all the human labour and ingenuity that come together in this medical moment.
sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.english: And as the president said last week, no one should bet against the American worker, American business and American ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

sentences.english: ‘Why are you doing that?’ the boy inquired.
sentences.chinese: “你为什么这么做？”男孩问道。

sentences.english: Toby would have liked to inquire further (= ask more questions ).
sentences.chinese: 托比本想问更多的问题。

sentences.english: The investigation will inquire into the company’s financial dealings.
sentences.chinese: 此次调查将会涉及公司的财务往来。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for information

sentences.english: This alternative would have to operate as any other insurer, on the basis of the premiums it collects.
sentences.chinese: 这个选项如同其他的保险公司一样，依靠它收取的保费生存。

sentences.english: At some moments in this crisis it has shown the way—by agreeing to supply dollars to countries that needed them, and by guaranteeing the contracts of European banks when it rescued a big insurer.
sentences.chinese: 在这次危机的某些时刻，美国显示出了这一做法，同意提供美元给需要的国家，而且当欧洲的银行在援救一个大保险公司的时候，担保它们的合约。

sentences.english: In between these visits, at the request of the hospital manager, I am constantly on the phone to my travel insurance party, as neither hospital nor insurer seems to accept what the other is saying.
sentences.chinese: 在那些探视者来访的间隙，按照医院经理的要求，我不断地和我的保险公司打电话，因为无论是医院还是保险公司似乎都不认同对方所说的情况。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that provides insurance

name: intensely
trans: adv. 强烈地；紧张地；热情地

sentences.english: I do not feel it intensely in my genitals alone, but I do feel it there as well as the rest of my body and…in my mouth…”.
sentences.chinese: 使用男性阳具我都没有这种强烈的感觉，但是在那里及身体的其他部位..还有嘴巴..我却感觉到了。

sentences.english: By 2011 debris in the center of the ring, which is about a light-year in diameter, was blazing more intensely as the supernova entered a new stage of stellar demise.
sentences.chinese: 到2011年为止，因为这个超新星进入了星球消亡的新阶段，所以这环物质中心直径大约是一光年的碎片燃烧的更加强烈了。

name: interact
trans: vt. 互相影响；互相作用
vi. 互相影响；互相作用

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: intimate
trans: adj. 亲密的；私人的；精通的；有性关系的

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: intolerance
trans: n. （尤指对别人的意见）不宽容；偏狭

sentences.english: ...his intolerance of any opinion other than his own.
sentences.chinese: …他对除自己以外任何观点的不容忍。

detailed_translations.english: unwillingness to accept ways of thinking and behaving that are different from your own

name: irreversible
trans: adj. 不可逆的；不能取消的；不能翻转的

sentences.english: Fossil fuels have caused irreversible damage to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 矿物燃料已对环境造成了不可挽回的破坏。

detailed_translations.english: irreversible damage, change etc is so serious or so great that you cannot change something back to how it was before

name: joint
trans: n. 关节；接缝；接合处，接合点；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉
adj. 共同的；连接的；联合的，合办的
vt. 连接，贴合；接合；使有接头

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: keen
trans: adj. 敏锐的，敏捷的；渴望的；强烈的；热心的；锐利的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: lawsuit
trans: n. 诉讼（尤指非刑事案件）；诉讼案件

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

name: layer
trans: n. 层，层次；膜；压条；放置者，计划者
vt. 把…分层堆放；借助压条法；生根繁殖；将（头发）剪成不同层次
vi. 形成或分成层次；通过压条法而生根

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

name: lessen
trans: vt. 使…变小；使…减轻；使…变少

sentences.english: Gradually her anxiety lessened.

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

name: disrupt
trans: vt. 破坏；使瓦解；使分裂；使中断；使陷于混乱
adj. 分裂的，中断的；分散的

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: distinct
trans: adj. 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

name: drone
trans: n. 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

sentences.english: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted

name: elevate
trans: vt. 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: endless
trans: adj. 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的

sentences.english: an endless stream of visitors
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的游客

sentences.english: The possibilities are endless.
sentences.chinese: 有无限的可能性。

sentences.english: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
sentences.chinese: 他麻烦太多了——毒品、枪支、敲诈——说都说不完。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount, size, or number

name: endorsement
trans: n. 认可，支持；背书；签注（文件）

sentences.english: There should be no suggestion of endorsement of the product or the company by WHO.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织不得对任何产品或公司提供支持建议。

name: entail
trans: vt. 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: ethical
trans: adj. 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: exaggeration
trans: n. 夸张；夸大之词；夸张的手法

sentences.english: It would be an exaggeration to say that we were close friends.
sentences.chinese: 说我们是密友不免言过其实了。

sentences.english: It is no exaggeration to say that everyone will be affected by the new policy.
sentences.chinese: 说人人都会受到新政策的影响一点也不夸张。

sentences.english: The situation can be described, without exaggeration, as disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 可以毫不夸张地说，这是灾难性的局面。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or way of saying something that makes something seem better, larger etc than it really is

name: exotic
trans: adj. 异国的；外来的；异国情调的

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: extensive
trans: adj. 广泛的；大量的；广阔的

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

name: faith
trans: n. 信仰；信念；信任；忠实

sentences.english: People have lost faith in the government.
sentences.chinese: 人们已失去了对政府的信心。

sentences.english: deep religious faith
sentences.chinese: 坚定的宗教信仰

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

name: favourable
trans: adj. 有利的，顺利的；赞成的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

sentences.english: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
sentences.chinese: 这种病在合适的条件下会传播得很快。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: favorable
trans: adj. 有利的；良好的；赞成的，赞许的；讨人喜欢的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的；可能的；可实行的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: fertility
trans: n. 多产；肥沃； 生产力；丰饶

detailed_translations.english: the ability of the land or soil to produce good crops

sentences.english: the earth’s finite resources
sentences.chinese: 地球有限的资源

detailed_translations.chinese: 有限的， 有限制的； 限定的
detailed_translations.english: having an end or a limit

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: grim
trans: adj. 冷酷的；糟糕的；残忍的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: halt
trans: vi. 停止；立定；踌躇，犹豫

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: imperative
trans: n. 必要的事；命令；需要；规则；祈使语气
adj. 必要的，不可避免的；紧急的；命令的，专横的；势在必行的；祈使的

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: impressive
trans: adj. 感人的；令人钦佩的；给人以深刻印象的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不充分的，不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: incidentally
trans: adv. 顺便；偶然地；附带地

sentences.english: Incidentally, where were you born?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

sentences.english: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说一下，这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

detailed_translations.english: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of

sentences.english: a steep incline
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: indulge
trans: vt. 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: infinite
trans: n. 无限； 无穷大；无限的东西（如空间，时间）
adj. 无限的，无穷的；无数的；极大的

sentences.english: The universe is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: without limits in space or time

name: instruct
trans: vt. 指导；通知；命令；教授

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: insufficient
trans: adj. 不足的，不充足的；不胜任的；缺乏能力的

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

sentences.english: the intrinsic interest of the subject
sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

detailed_translations.english: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略；侵袭；侵扰；涌入
vi. 侵略；侵入；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: irrelevant
trans: adj. 不相干的；不切题的

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

name: jeopardize
trans: vt. 危害；使陷危地；使受危困

sentences.english: large-scale military offensives which could jeopardize the UN peace process
sentences.chinese: 可能会破坏联合国和平进程的大规模军事进攻

detailed_translations.english: to risk losing or spoiling something important

name: linger
trans: vi. 徘徊；苟延残喘；磨蹭

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: literary
trans: adj. 文学的；书面的；精通文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: lobby
trans: n. 大厅；休息室；会客室；游说议员的团体

sentences.english: a hotel lobby
sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: manifest
trans: n. 载货单，货单；旅客名单
adj. 显然的，明显的；明白的

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: marginal
trans: adj. 边缘的；临界的；末端的

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

name: monopoly
trans: n. 垄断；垄断者；专卖权

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

name: motion
trans: n. 动作；移动；手势；请求；意向；议案

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: multiply
trans: vt. 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。

sentences.english: a multitude of possible interpretations
sentences.chinese: 种种可能的解释

detailed_translations.english: a very large number of people or things

sentences.english: the British Navy
sentences.chinese: 英国海军

sentences.english: He joined the navy during the war.
sentences.chinese: 他在战争期间参加了海军。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea

name: noble
trans: adj. 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

name: nominal
trans: adj. 名义上的；有名无实的； 票面上的

sentences.english: the nominal head of the rebellion
sentences.chinese: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人

sentences.english: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

detailed_translations.chinese: 名义上的， 有名无实的； 很少的， 象征性的； 名词性的
detailed_translations.english: officially described as being something, when this is not really true

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: orientation
trans: n. 方向；定向；适应；情况介绍；向东方

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

sentences.english: Employers may become overly cautious about taking on new staff.
sentences.chinese: 雇主在雇用新员工的问题上可能会过于谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: Overly means more than is normal, necessary, or reasonable

sentences.english: The central section of the book is a historical overview of drug use.
sentences.chinese: 本书的中心部分是对药物使用的一个历史概述。

detailed_translations.english: a short description of a subject or situation that gives the main ideas without explaining all the details

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的；势不可挡的
v. 压倒；淹没（overwhelm的ing形式）；制服

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: passive
trans: adj. 被动的，消极的；被动语态的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: perish
trans: vi. 死亡；毁灭；腐烂；枯萎

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: proceeding
trans: n. 进行；程序；诉讼；事项
v. 开始；继续做；行进（proceed的ing形式）

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

name: quantify
trans: vt. 量化；为…定量；确定数量

sentences.english: an attempt to quantify the region’s social and economic decline
sentences.chinese: 对该地区社会和经济衰退进行量化的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to calculate the value of something and express it as a number or an amount

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

name: refine
trans: vt. 精炼，提纯；改善；使…文雅

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

name: refuge
trans: vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: restructure
trans: vt. 调整；重建；更改结构

sentences.english: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
sentences.chinese: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

detailed_translations.english: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要； 履历，简历
vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: retrieve
trans: vt.  检索；恢复；重新得到

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: revise
trans: vi. 修订；校订；复习功课

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: sacrifice
trans: vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

name: senate
trans: n. 参议院，上院；（古罗马的）元老院

sentences.english: The Senate approved the bill.
sentences.chinese: 参议院批准了这项议案。

detailed_translations.english: the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France

sentences.english: The residents are being asked to shoulder the costs of the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 居民们被要求承担这笔修理费用。

sentences.english: They shouldered the boat and took it down to the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们把船扛在肩上抬到河里。

detailed_translations.english: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc

name: slim
trans: adj. 苗条的；修长的；微小的；差的
vt. 使…体重减轻；使…苗条

sentences.english: a slim young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材苗条的年轻女子

sentences.english: a slim waist
sentences.chinese: 纤腰

detailed_translations.chinese: 苗条的；修长的；微小的；差的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is slim is attractively thin
to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking a lot of exercise etc

detailed_translations.chinese: (Slim)人名；(阿拉伯)萨利姆；(英、西)斯利姆

name: spacious
trans: adj. 宽敞的，广阔的；无边无际的

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

sentences.english: sparks from the fire
sentences.chinese: 火里飞出的火星

sentences.english: The scrape of metal on metal sent up a shower of sparks .
sentences.chinese: 金属之间互相摩擦，迸出一串火星。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together
a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: spur
trans: n. 鼓舞，刺激；马刺；山坡
vt. 激励，鞭策；给…装踢马刺
vi. 骑马疾驰；给予刺激

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金
vt. 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

sentences.english: a discussion of marriage from the standpoint of women
sentences.chinese: 从女性角度对婚姻的探讨

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about people, situations, ideas etc

sentences.english: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
sentences.chinese: 如果建筑商不履行合同，我们就要提出起诉。

sentences.english: The company is suing a former employee.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正在起诉一名前雇员。

sentences.english: The railway may sue for damages (= in order to get money ) because of loss of revenue.
sentences.chinese: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉，要求赔偿。

sentences.english: He is being sued for divorce (= in order to end a marriage ) by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子对他提出起诉，要求离婚。

detailed_translations.english: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sue)人名；(日)末(名)；(法)休；(英)休(女子教名Susan、Susanna的昵称)

name: suspend
trans: vt. 延缓，推迟；使暂停；使悬浮

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

name: tactic
trans: adj. 按顺序的，依次排列的

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: tolerant
trans: adj. 宽容的；容忍的；有耐药力的

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: undertake
trans: vt. 承担，保证；从事；同意；试图

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: unfavorable
trans: adj. 不宜的；令人不快的；不顺利的

sentences.english: It will save you from nasty surprises and you will be financially, mentally and legally prepared to save your business from unfavorable consequences of cloud computing.
sentences.chinese: 这样才不至于出现意想不到的不愉快，你要准备好从而避免在财务上、精神上和法律上承担云计算的不利后果。

sentences.english: Despite their desire to be more market-oriented, many of the rural banks may come under pressure from local officials to make loans on unfavorable terms, pushing up their NPLs.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有加强市场导向的期望,但是多数农村银行或受到当地政府的压力,以不利的合同条款发放贷款,从而推高不良贷款.

detailed_translations.chinese: 不宜的；令人不快的；不顺利的

name: virtual
trans: adj.  虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: vision
trans: n. 视力；美景；眼力；幻象；想象力；幻视（漫威漫画旗下超级英雄）

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: weigh
trans: vi. 重量为…；具有重要性；成为…的重荷；起锚

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: whereby
trans: adv. 凭借；通过…；借以；与…一致

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: withdraw
trans: vt. 撤退；收回；撤消；拉开

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: adhere
trans: vi. 坚持；依附；粘着；追随

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

sentences.english: ...a wealthy southern aristocrat.
sentences.chinese: …一位富有的南方贵族。

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: bitter
trans: adj. 苦的；痛苦的；尖刻的；充满仇恨的
adv. 激烈地；严寒刺骨地

sentences.english: His photo stirred up bitter memories.
sentences.chinese: 他的照片勾起了痛苦的回忆。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very unhappy and upset

name: bleak
trans: adj. 阴冷的；荒凉的，无遮蔽的；黯淡的，无希望的；冷酷的；单调的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

sentences.english: He’s always willing to help. Bless him!
sentences.chinese: 他一向乐于助人，愿上帝保佑他！

sentences.english: ‘Jess made this card for me.’ ‘Bless!’
sentences.chinese: “杰斯给我做了这张卡。”“真不错！”

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are fond of someone, amused by them, or pleased by something they have done

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: brew
trans: vi. 酿酒；被冲泡；即将发生

sentences.english: Every beer on the menu was brewed locally.
sentences.chinese: 酒单上的所有啤酒都是本地酿造的。

detailed_translations.english: to make beer
to make beer
a drink that is brewed, especially tea

name: brilliant
trans: adj. 灿烂的，闪耀的；杰出的；有才气的；精彩的，绝妙的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: browse
trans: vi. 浏览；吃草；漫不经心地看商品

sentences.english: a feature that allows you to browse your hard drive and choose the graphic you want to display
sentences.chinese: 让你可以浏览硬盘驱动器选择自己想要显示的图像的一个功能

sentences.english: ...a browse around the shops.
sentences.chinese: …在商店的一番闲逛。

detailed_translations.english: to look through the pages of a book, magazine etc without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts
Browse is also a noun

name: buzz
trans: vt. 使嗡嗡叫；暗中散布
vi. 作嗡嗡声；东奔西忙
n. 网络口碑（消费者或网民对于品牌、产品等广告主在乎的事情在网上发出的各种声音）

sentences.english: a loud buzzing noise
sentences.chinese: 很大的嗡嗡声

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出嗡嗡声；忙乱，急行；发出嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: to make a continuous sound, like the sound of a  bee

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗡嗡声； 嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: a continuous noise like the sound of a  bee

name: casual
trans: n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵
adj. 随便的；非正式的；临时的；偶然的

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: cherish
trans: vt. 怀有（感情等）；抱有（希望等）

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: commute
trans: vt. 减刑；交换；用……交换；使……变成

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: competent
trans: adj. 胜任的；有能力的；能干的；足够的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: comply
trans: vi. 遵守；顺从，遵从；答应

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: compulsory
trans: n. （花样滑冰、竞技体操等的）规定动作
adj. 义务的；必修的；被强制的

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

name: conserve
trans: vt. 保存；将…做成蜜饯；使守恒

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

name: constraint
trans: n.  约束；局促，态度不自然；强制

sentences.english: the constraints of family life
sentences.chinese: 家庭生活的约束

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制
detailed_translations.english: something that limits your freedom to do what you want

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: copyright
trans: adj. 版权的；受版权保护的
vt. 保护版权；为…取得版权

sentences.english: Who owns the copyright of this book?
sentences.chinese: 谁拥有这本书的版权？

sentences.english: The database will be protected by copyright .
sentences.chinese: 这个数据库将受到版权保护。

detailed_translations.english: the legal right to be the only producer or seller of a book, play, film, or record for a specific length of time

name: correlation
trans: n.  相关，关联；相互关系

sentences.english: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.
sentences.chinese: …吸烟和疾病之间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two ideas, facts etc, especially when one may be the cause of the other

sentences.english: a famous film clip which has been shown countless times
sentences.chinese: 播放了无数次的一段著名电影选段

detailed_translations.english: too many to be counted

name: crude
trans: adj. 粗糙的；天然的，未加工的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

name: curve
trans: n. 曲线；弯曲；曲线球；曲线图表

sentences.english: a sweeping curve of railroad track
sentences.chinese: 铁轨的大弧线

sentences.english: The car took the curve much too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那辆汽车拐弯太快了。

sentences.english: The track curved round the side of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 小路弯弯曲曲，依山盘旋。

detailed_translations.english: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle
to bend or move in the shape of a curve, or to make something do this

name: deliberate
trans: adj. 故意的；深思熟虑的；从容的

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: delicate
trans: adj. 微妙的；精美的，雅致的；柔和的；易碎的；纤弱的；清淡可口的

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: desperate
trans: adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

sentences.english: It will be a devastating blow for the town if the factory closes.
sentences.chinese: 如果工厂关闭，对该镇来说将是沉重的打击。

detailed_translations.english: badly damaging or destroying something

name: dilemma
trans: n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面; 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 解散；解雇；开除；让...离开；不予理会、不予考虑

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

sentences.english: The daily dosage is steadily reduced over several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 几周之内逐渐减少每日剂量。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or drug that you should take at one time, especially regularly

name: drift
trans: n. 漂流，漂移；趋势；漂流物
vt. 使…漂流；使…受风吹积

sentences.english: Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们前方的丛林里有烟升起。

sentences.english: Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮这一年来一直在欧洲各地漂泊。

sentences.english: a drift towards longer working hours
sentences.chinese: 工作时间不知不觉的变长

sentences.english: the drift from the countryside to the cities
sentences.chinese: 大量人口从乡村往城市的流动

detailed_translations.english: to move slowly on water or in the air
a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的
vt. 精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: elect
trans: n. 被选的人；特殊阶层；上帝的选民
adj. 选出的；当选的；卓越的
vi. 作出选择；进行选举

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: embark
trans: vi. 从事，着手；上船或飞机

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: emergence
trans: n. 出现，浮现；发生；露头

sentences.english: The day after that, the emergence of a new competitor.
sentences.chinese: 今后的每一天都可能出现新的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Language emerges and develops with the emergence and development of society.
sentences.chinese: 语言是随着社会的产生而产生，随着社会的发展而发展的。

sentences.english: They prefer to wait for the emergence of a new physics theory of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们更倾向于等待新的可以解释一切的理论的出现.

detailed_translations.english: when something begins to be known or noticed

name: enrich
trans: vt. 使充实；使肥沃；使富足

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: expenditure
trans: n. 支出，花费；经费，消费额

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: fascinate
trans: vt. 使着迷，使神魂颠倒

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: flavour
trans: vt. 给……调味；给……增添风趣

sentences.english: Which flavour do you want - chocolate or vanilla?
sentences.chinese: 你要哪种味道的，巧克力还是香草？

detailed_translations.english: the particular taste of a food or drink

name: flavor
trans: n. 情味，风味；香料；滋味

sentences.english: Do you like its flavor?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢它的味道吗?。

sentences.english: When things had flavor , we knew what we were eating all the while ----and it satisfied us .
sentences.chinese: 当食物有滋味的时候，我们从头到尾都知道自己吃的是什么，从中得到满足。

sentences.english: I consider the eels to be the best quality protein in my line—a very unique flavor of fish, applewood smoke, and a momentary lingering of dark, fall honey.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，在我的行当里，鳗鱼是最优质的蛋白质——一种非常独特的风味鱼，用苹果木烟熏，在暗处晾一会，再抹上秋天的蜂蜜。

name: flaw
trans: n. 瑕疵，缺点；一阵狂风；短暂的风暴；裂缝，裂纹
v. 使生裂缝，使有裂纹；使无效；使有缺陷
vi. 生裂缝；变的有缺陷

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: float
trans: n. 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
vi. 浮动；飘动，散播；摇摆；付诸实施

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.

trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰

sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

trans: adj. 喜欢的；温柔的；宠爱的

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

vt. 开动；搭上齿轮；使……适合；使……准备好
vi. 适合；搭上齿轮；开始工作

sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius

sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

name: govern
trans: vt. 管理；支配；统治；控制
vi. 居支配地位；进行统治

sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

trans: n. 紧握；柄；支配；握拍方式；拍柄绷带

sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.chinese: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车

sentences.chinese: 有害废弃物的处理

sentences.chinese: 那食物看上去很糟，可吃起来还不错。

sentences.chinese: 在干燥的季节里,它可能会遭到另一个种类的蚂蚁攻击。

sentences.chinese: 他后来知道，在260英里以外纽泽西州另一个昆虫学家也观察到同一种类蚂蚁举行飞行婚礼的时间，竟和他记录的在同一天、同一个时刻！

sentences.chinese: 爸爸第一次下煤矿井时才15岁。

sentences.chinese: 一盒空白磁带

sentences.chinese: 你填好表格以后把它交还给我。

sentences.chinese: 我找到一个新的健身房。

sentences.chinese: 第二天，纵火犯在一家体育馆被逮捕了。

name: exhibition

sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

name: deplete

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚

sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: steam
trans: vt. 蒸，散发；用蒸汽处理
