sentences.chinese: 水蒸气从热腾腾的浴缸里升起。

detailed_translations.english: the hot mist that water produces when it is boiled
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot

name: accent
trans: n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
vt. 强调；重读；带…口音讲话

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

sentences.english: It took all his willpower to remain calm.
sentences.chinese: 他竭尽全力才保持了镇定。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to control your mind and body in order to achieve something that you want to do

name: alien
trans: n. 外国人，外侨；外星人
adj. 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race

name: autonomous
trans: adj. 自治的；自主的；自发的

sentences.english: They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province.
sentences.chinese: 他们自豪地宣布自己是新自治省的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: an autonomous place or organization is free to govern or control itself

name: digest
trans: vt. 消化；吸收；融会贯通

sentences.english: Most babies can digest a wide range of food easily.
sentences.chinese: 大多数婴儿能轻易地消化很多种食物。

sentences.english: I struggled to digest the news.
sentences.chinese: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

sentences.english: a monthly news digest
sentences.chinese: 每月新闻摘要

a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

trans: n. 块，块状；肿块；瘤；很多；笨人
vt. 混在一起；使成块状；忍耐；笨重地移动

sentences.english: You are the one with a lump.
sentences.chinese: 你是那个有了肿块的人。

sentences.english: One day, I noticed a lump in her skin.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我注意到她皮肤上有个肿块。

sentences.english: Then the lump or cancer attaches itself to this wall.
sentences.chinese: 然后肿块或癌就附着在那钙壁上。

detailed_translations.english: to collect into a mass or group
a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape
to put two or more different people or things together and consider them as a single group, sometimes wrongly

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: minimize
trans: vt. 使减到最少；小看，极度轻视

sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

trans: vt. 迷住，缠住；使…着迷；使…困扰

sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: revolutionize
trans: vt. 发动革命；彻底改革；宣传革命

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
sentences.chinese: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。

sentences.english: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
sentences.chinese: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

sentences.chinese: 下面一层有一万个座位。

detailed_translations.english: one of several levels or layers that rise up one above the other

name: carbohydrate
trans: n.  碳水化合物； 糖类

sentences.english: Around one third of our meals should be based on carbohydrate, with roughly one half of these grains being whole.
sentences.chinese: 我们每餐食物应当差不多有三分之一是碳水化合物，大概有一半谷物食品为全麦的。

sentences.english: There have been no studies of the effects of a low carbohydrate diet on pregnancy, so its effect on the fetus, if any, are unknown.
sentences.chinese: 目前为止还没有关于怀孕时低碳水化合物饮食影响的研究，因此如果对胎儿有什么影响也是不知道的。

sentences.english: The reason for this is that carbohydrate consumption stimulates insulin production, which aids the production of muscle glycogen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为是碳水化合物的消耗刺激了胰岛素的分泌，后者对于肌肉糖原产生有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is in foods such as sugar, bread, and potatoes, which provides your body with heat and energy and which consists of oxygen,  hydrogen  , and  carbon

name: formula
trans: n.  公式，准则；配方；婴儿食品

sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

sentences.chinese: 我们已有很长一段时间雨量偏低。

sentences.chinese: 其中一种含有一些只有接触才能发现的苦味的添加剂。

sentences.chinese: 介绍了独特的逻辑概念的互补成添加剂的特性，我们发现一个有趣的结果。

sentences.chinese: 正如以上所提到的，将不同的元素通过加法和减法的方式，慢慢地组合到一起是一个需要不断反复的过程。

sentences.chinese: 我们要在微积分学中考虑这些因素。

sentences.english: All this leads up to the most fundamental of theorems of calculus .
sentences.chinese: 综上所述就导出了微积分学中的最基本的定理。

sentences.english: Obstruction with stasis also led to the formation of the yellow-brown calculus (stone).
sentences.chinese: 伴有尿液郁积的阻塞还能导致黄褐色的结石（石头）形成。

name: harmonious

sentences.chinese: 乔贝还以其大群的大象和水牛而闻名。

sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

sentences.chinese: 儿童的适应力一般都很强。

sentences.chinese: 公司在经济衰退期间表现出惊人的耐挫力。

sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射

sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

trans: n. 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌

sentences.chinese: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

sentences.english: What is your surname?
sentences.chinese: 你姓什么?

sentences.english: Your surname may be derived from a place, such as Lancaster, for example, or an occupation, such as Weaver, but this is not necessarily of relevance to your family history.

name: unpredictable

sentences.chinese: 他这个人完全让人捉摸不透。

name: advisable
trans: adj. 明智的，可取的，适当的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.

name: renovate
trans: vt. 更新；修复；革新；刷新

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

name: snap

vi. 咬；厉声说；咯嗒一声关上

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

sentences.english: She still needs to analyse the data.
sentences.chinese: 她仍需要分析这些数据。

sentences.english: You need to sit down and analyse why you feel so upset.
sentences.chinese: 你得坐下来想一想自己为什么会那么生气。

sentences.english: Joe had never tried to analyze their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 乔从未试图去理清他们的关系。

detailed_translations.english: to examine the nature or structure of sth, especially by separating it into its parts, in order to understand or explain it

name: analyze
trans: vt. 对…进行分析，分解（等于analyse）

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: irrational
trans: adj. 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的

sentences.english: an irrational fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: maximum
trans: n.  极大，最大限度；最大量
adj. 最高的；最多的；最大极限的

sentences.english: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。

sentences.english: They made maximum use of the resources available.
sentences.chinese: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。

sentences.english: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
sentences.chinese: 要想获得最佳的效果，这些运动要做得慢一点。

sentences.english: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
sentences.chinese: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。

sentences.english: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

sentences.english: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元，一次性给付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最大的； 最高的； 顶点的
detailed_translations.english: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

sentences.english: He asked permission to leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 他请求离开房间的许可。

sentences.english: They cannot leave the country without permission.
sentences.chinese: 没有许可他们不得离开这个国家。

detailed_translations.english: the act of allowing sb to do sth, especially when this is done by sb in a position of authority

sentences.english: Joe ran his tongue over his dry lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔舔了舔干燥的嘴唇。

sentences.english: The taste of the chocolate was still on her tongue.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力的余味依然留在她的舌尖。

sentences.english: The girl scowled at me, then stuck out her tongue .
sentences.chinese: 女孩怒视着我，然后吐了一下舌头。

detailed_translations.english: the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking

sentences.english: I can't render my thought accurately.
sentences.chinese: 我不能将我的思想准确地表达出来。

sentences.english: We should train our students to speak English fluently and accurately.
sentences.chinese: 我们应培养学生流利而准确地讲英语。

name: acquaintance
trans: n. 熟人；相识；了解；知道

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

name: companion
trans: n. 同伴；朋友；指南；手册

sentences.english: For ten years he had been her constant companion .
sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion
sentences.chinese: 旅伴

detailed_translations.english: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["weapons of mass destruction"]}
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
sentences.chinese: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏

sentences.english: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏， 毁灭； 消灭
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

name: devise
trans: vt. 设计；想出；发明；图谋；遗赠给

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

sentences.english: Ecologists argue that the benefits of treating sewage with disinfectants are doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 生态学家们认为用消毒剂处理污水的好处是值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies ecology

name: gale
trans: n.  大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: isolate
trans: vt. 使隔离；使孤立；使绝缘

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: lane
trans: n. 小巷； 航线；车道；罚球区

sentences.english: a quiet country lane
sentences.chinese: 一条宁静的乡间小路

sentences.english: ...after being disqualified for running out of his lane in the 200 metres.
sentences.chinese: …在200米比赛中由于冲出跑道而被取消比赛资格以后。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow road in the countryside

name: misconception
trans: n. 误解；错觉；错误想法

sentences.english: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 说佩吉以前极其富有，这是一个错误的看法。

detailed_translations.english: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly

sentences.english: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications.
sentences.chinese: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年，期间只做过很小的改动。

detailed_translations.english: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: obscure
trans: adj. 昏暗的，朦胧的；晦涩的，不清楚的；隐蔽的；不著名的，无名的
vt. 使…模糊不清，掩盖；隐藏；使难理解
n. 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: refresh
trans: vt. 更新；使……恢复；使……清新；消除……的疲劳
vi. 恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

sentences.english: Many of the families are forced to live at the subsistence level.
sentences.chinese: 很多家庭被迫生活在基本生活水准线上。

sentences.english: The land provided subsistence and little more.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地只能提供人们的基本生活所需，别无富余。

detailed_translations.english: the condition of only just having enough money or food to stay alive

name: unintended
trans: adj. 无意识的；非计划中的

sentences.english: ...the unintended consequences of human action.
sentences.chinese: ...人类行为无心的结果。

detailed_translations.english: Unintended results were not planned to happen, although they happened

sentences.english: There are more than 400 miles of waterways to explore in the area.
sentences.chinese: 此地有400多英里的航道有待勘察。

detailed_translations.english: a river or canal that boats travel on

sentences.english: Challenge yourself academically, but give yourself plenty of time for fun as well.
sentences.chinese: 学业上要努力，但也要给自己充足的娱乐时间。

sentences.english: "Research in the UK shows those born at the start of the school year also do better academically and have more confidence," he said.
sentences.chinese: 班纳还说道：“英国的研究人员还发现，在学校学年开始时出生的人，会在学术上表现得较好，而且他们也更有自信。”

name: accessibility
trans: n. 易接近；可亲；可以得到

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: bake
trans: vi. 烘面包；被烤干；受热

sentences.english: I’m baking some bread.
sentences.chinese: 我在烤一些面包。

sentences.english: baked potatoes
sentences.chinese: 烤马铃薯

sentences.english: Bake at 250 degrees for 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 用250度的温度烤20分钟。

sentences.english: The bricks were baked in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 砖块放在太阳光下晒硬。

detailed_translations.english: to cook something using dry heat, in an oven

sentences.english: In April 655, Osman’s palace was besieged by rebels.
sentences.chinese: 公元655年4月，奥斯曼的宫殿遭到叛军围攻。

detailed_translations.english: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control

sentences.english: Blend the sugar, eggs, and flour.
sentences.chinese: 把糖、鸡蛋和面粉掺在一起。

sentences.english: a blend of tea
sentences.chinese: 混合茶叶

detailed_translations.english: to thoroughly mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance
a mixture of different types of the same thing

sentences.english: A botanist can differentiate varieties of plants.
sentences.chinese: 植物学家能区分各种不同的植物。

sentences.english: Along with English botanist Joseph Hooker, Lyell was one of a small handful of people Darwin had shown early drafts of his own work on natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 同英国植物学家约瑟夫·胡克一样，莱尔是少数了解达尔文在自然选择学说方面研究的早期草稿的人之一。

sentences.english: Forty-five years on, the French botanist's gardens have grown massive in scale.
sentences.chinese: 四十五年过去，这法国植物学家的花园规模更大。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make scientific studies of wild plants

sentences.english: Perhaps intelligence and civilisation are not what we should be concentrating on.
sentences.chinese: 也许智能和文明不属于我们应该关注的问题。

sentences.english: If I have understood you correctly, you are proposing to do nothing to prevent the likely collapse of industrial civilisation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对你的理解正确的话，你在主张不做任何事情去防止可能的工业文明的崩溃。

sentences.english: Let us examine our history and see how men - the master race for all of our recorded history in almost every corner of every human civilisation - have fared so far.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，让我们检查一下我们的历史，并且看看男性——在我们所有现存历史，几乎每一个人类文明的角落都是统治者的族群，是如何发展的。

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time
an animal or plant that is a mixture of breeds

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: dissertation
trans: n. 论文，专题；学术演讲

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

name: establishment
trans: n. 确立，制定；公司；设施

sentences.english: the establishment of NATO in 1949
sentences.chinese: 1949年北约组织的建立

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

name: evaporate
trans: vt. 使……蒸发；使……脱水；使……消失
vi. 蒸发，挥发；消失，失踪

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: explosive
trans: adj. 爆炸的；爆炸性的；爆发性的

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

name: external
trans: adj. 外部的；表面的； 外用的；外国的；外面的

sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

sentences.english: With geological maps, books, and atlases you can find out all the proven sites of precious minerals.
sentences.chinese: 有了地质地图、书籍和地图册，你就可以找到所有已探明的珍贵矿藏的位置。

detailed_translations.english: Geological means relating to geology

name: hectic
trans: adj. 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的

sentences.english: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
sentences.chinese: 我忙乱了一整天。

sentences.english: a hectic social life
sentences.chinese: 繁忙的社交生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
detailed_translations.english: very busy or full of activity

name: hobbyist
trans: n. 业余爱好者；沉溺于某嗜好之人

detailed_translations.chinese: 业余爱好者；沉溺于某嗜好之人
detailed_translations.english: You can refer to person who is very interested in a particular hobby and spends a lot of time on it as a hobbyist

name: hollow
trans: adj. 空的；中空的，空腹的；凹的；虚伪的

sentences.english: a hollow tree
sentences.chinese: 空心树

sentences.english: Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.
sentences.chinese: 任何要叫警察来的威胁都是虚张声势。

sentences.english: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个世纪的踩踏，台阶上出现了凹痕

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的,中空的;；空洞的,无价值的
detailed_translations.english: having an empty space inside
to make the surface of something curve inwards

name: irritate
trans: vi. 引起恼怒，引起不愉快

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: jungle
trans: n. 丛林，密林；危险地带

sentences.english: the Amazon jungle
sentences.chinese: 亚马孙丛林

detailed_translations.english: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

sentences.english: a garage mechanic
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂的技工

detailed_translations.english: someone who is skilled at repairing motor vehicles and machinery

name: milestone
trans: n. 里程碑，划时代的事件

sentences.english: He said the launch of the party represented a milestone in Zambian history.
sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: rationality
trans: n. 合理性；合理的行动

sentences.english: Organizational effectiveness does not lie in that narrow minded concept called rationality. It lies in the blend of clearheaded logic and powerful intuition.
sentences.chinese: 组织的有效性并不在于那个称为合理性的坐井观天的概念。它是清晰的逻辑和强有力的直觉的融合。

sentences.english: But whoever has undergone the intense experience of successful advances made in this domain is moved by profound reverence for the rationality made manifest in existence.
sentences.chinese: 但凡是曾经在这个领域里胜利前进中有过深切经验的人，对存在中所显示出来的合理性，都会感到深挚的崇敬。

sentences.english: The military conceptual model is the first abstract to the military action world(space), the accuracy and rationality it expresses the military system is the key point of battle simulation.
sentences.chinese: 军事概念模型是对军事行为空间进行的第一次抽象，它对军事系统表达的准确性和合理性将是作战仿真模拟质量的关键。

sentences.english: I play the piano for relaxation.
sentences.chinese: 我弹钢琴自娱。

sentences.english: Meditation allows you to enter a state of deep relaxation .
sentences.chinese: 冥想能使你进入完全放松的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a way of resting and enjoying yourself

name: relevant
trans: adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

name: spicy
trans: adj. 辛辣的；香的，多香料的；下流的

sentences.english: a spicy tomato sauce
sentences.chinese: 辣番茄酱

detailed_translations.chinese: 加很多香料的；(口味)浓郁的
detailed_translations.english: food that is spicy has a pleasantly strong taste, and gives you a pleasant burning feeling in your mouth

name: surpass
trans: vt. 超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: theoretical
trans: adj. 理论的；理论上的；假设的；推理的

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

name: transmission
trans: n. 传动装置， 变速器；传递；传送；播送

sentences.english: worldwide data transmission
sentences.chinese: 全球数据传输

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending out electronic signals, messages etc, using radio, television, or other similar equipment

name: wrestle
trans: vt. 与摔跤；与…搏斗；使劲搬动

sentences.english: They run races; they wrestle; and sometimes they have mock fights together.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁参加各种赛跑，摔跤，有时还在一起模拟战斗。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone by holding them and pulling or pushing them

name: authorship
trans: n. （书等的）原创作者，来源；作者的身份；著述业

name: bare
trans: adj. 空的；赤裸的，无遮蔽的

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

name: chronicle
trans: n. 编年史，年代记；记录
vt. 记录；把…载入编年史

sentences.english: His life is chronicled in a new biography published last week.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平被写成一本新传记，于上周出版。

sentences.english: The book chronicles the events leading up to the war.
sentences.chinese: 该书记述了导致战争爆发的一系列事件。

detailed_translations.english: to describe events in the order in which they happened

name: collegial
trans: adj. 学院的；社团的；大学生的

name: decode
trans: vt. 译(密码文电等)，译(码)，解(码)等：；(尤指在学习过程中)把拼写和读音关系用于(阅读)
vi. 从事破译(或解译)工作

sentences.english: The software decodes the information embedded in the satellite broadcasts.
sentences.chinese: 这种软件能够解读卫星广播中的信息。

detailed_translations.english: if a computer decodes data, it receives it and changes it into a form that can be used by the computer or understood by a person

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: disturb
trans: vt. 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: fulfil
trans: vt. 履行；完成；实践；满足

sentences.english: There is little doubt that the scheme fulfils a need for our community.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，这计划会满足我们社区的需求。

sentences.english: Visiting Disneyland has fulfilled a boyhood dream.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼乐园之游使童年梦想成真。

detailed_translations.english: to do or provide what is necessary or needed

name: fulfill
trans: vt. 履行；实现；满足；使结束（等于fulfil）

sentences.english: And that is why we can fulfill our destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们能实现我们的命运。

sentences.english: What important dream have you yet to realize and fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么重要的梦想还没有实现和完成？

name: grey
trans: vt. 使变成灰色；使变老

sentences.english: an old lady with grey hair
sentences.chinese: 头发灰白的老太太

sentences.english: a grey sky
sentences.chinese: 灰色的天空

sentences.english: Do you have these skirts in grey?
sentences.chinese: 这些裙子有灰色的吗？

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white
the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white

name: gray
trans: adj. 灰色的；苍白的；灰白头发的；阴郁的

sentences.english: I like that little gray one. The kids like that one too.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢那只灰色的小鸭子， 孩子们也喜欢那只。

sentences.english: Once again he found himself inside the apartment in the enormous gray house.
sentences.chinese: 他又一次发现自己在那所庞大的灰色的房子的房间里了。

sentences.english: If I live in the Pacific Ocean, I can be gray with black spots.
sentences.chinese: 如果我生活在太平洋，我的颜色很可能是带有黑点的灰色。

sentences.english: The airliner was hijacked by a group of terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 该航班被一帮恐怖分子劫持。

detailed_translations.english: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship
when a plane, vehicle etc is hijacked

name: honour
trans: vt. 尊敬； 承兑；承兑远期票据

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

name: honor
trans: vt. 尊敬（等于honour）；给…以荣誉

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

name: impart
trans: vt. 给予（尤指抽象事物），传授；告知，透露

sentences.english: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.english: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give a particular quality to something

name: injection
trans: n. 注射；注射剂；充血；射入轨道

sentences.english: The nurse gave me a tetanus injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士给我打了破伤风预防针。

sentences.english: The children hate having injections.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们讨厌打针。

sentences.english: a fuel injection system
sentences.chinese: 燃料注入系统

detailed_translations.english: an act of putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle

name: irresponsible
trans: adj. 不负责任的；不可靠的

sentences.english: It was highly irresponsible of him to leave the children on their own in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 他把孩子们独自留在游泳池里，真是太不负责任了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不对更高一级负责的；不承担责任的；无责任感的；无负责能力的
detailed_translations.english: doing careless things without thinking or worrying about the possible bad results

detailed_translations.chinese: 不负责任的人， 无责任感的人

name: laborious
trans: adj. 勤劳的；艰苦的；费劲的

sentences.english: the laborious business of drying the crops
sentences.chinese: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

detailed_translations.english: taking a lot of time and effort

name: leaf
trans: n. 叶子；（书籍等的）一张；扇页

sentences.english: a flowering bush with large shiny leaves
sentences.chinese: 叶子大而油亮的开花灌木

detailed_translations.chinese: 叶子；（书籍等的）一张；扇页
detailed_translations.english: one of the flat green parts of a plant that are joined to its stem or branches

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

sentences.english: It’s difficult to earn a livelihood as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 搞艺术很难谋生。

sentences.english: Bates says he will lose his livelihood if his driving licence is taken away.
sentences.chinese: 贝茨说，如果驾照被吊销，他就没有了谋生的手段。

detailed_translations.english: the way you earn money in order to live

name: masterpiece
trans: n. 杰作；绝无仅有的人

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

sentences.english: The risks can be so complex that banks hire mathematicians to assess them.
sentences.chinese: 这类风险可以是如此复杂以至于银行雇佣数学家们去评估它们。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

sentences.english: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

name: miniature
trans: n. 缩图；微型画；微型图画绘画术

sentences.english: She’s her mother in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 她是她母亲的缩影。

sentences.english: a miniature railway
sentences.chinese: 微型铁路

detailed_translations.english: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
much smaller than normal

sentences.english: There must have been some misunderstanding. I didn’t order all these books.
sentences.chinese: 一定是弄错了，这些书不全是我订的。

detailed_translations.english: a problem caused by someone not understanding a question, situation, or instruction correctly

name: necessity
trans: n. 需要；必然性；必需品

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: needle
trans: n. 针；指针；刺激；针状物

sentences.english: She carried hypodermic needles and syringes in her bag.
sentences.chinese: 她包里带着皮下注射针和针筒。

sentences.english: Drug users are at risk when they share needles.
sentences.chinese: 吸毒者共用注射针很危险。

detailed_translations.english: a very thin, pointed steel tube at the end of a syringe, which is pushed into your skin to put a drug or medicine into your body or to take out blood

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

sentences.english: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
sentences.chinese: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。

sentences.english: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated (= is very important ).
sentences.chinese: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

name: pave
trans: vt. 铺设；安排；作铺设之用

sentences.english: a paved courtyard
sentences.chinese: 地面铺砌过的院子

detailed_translations.english: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or  concrete

sentences.english: Skinner was the psychologist who popularized behavior modification.
sentences.chinese: 斯金纳就是那位使行为矫正概念得到普及的心理学家。

detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult subject or idea able to be easily understood by ordinary people who have no special knowledge about it

name: presumably
trans: adv. 大概；推测起来；可假定

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料
vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充
vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: satisfactory
trans: adj. 满意的；符合要求的；赎罪的

sentences.english: His progress this term has been satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 他这学期的进步令人满意。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for a particular purpose

name: scratch
trans: n. 擦伤；抓痕；刮擦声；乱写
adj. 打草稿用的；凑合的；碰巧的
vi. 抓；搔；发刮擦声；勉强糊口；退出比赛

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

sentences.english: Each user should have access to a security level based upon the level of data sensitivity he or she can see.
sentences.chinese: 根据用户可以看到的数据的敏感性级别，每个用户都应该可以访问某个安全级别。

sentences.english: The authentication mode you choose for your environment will be determined by the level of sensitivity of your data.
sentences.chinese: 应该为您的环境选择什么样的身份验证模式，这是由数据的敏感级别来决定的。

sentences.english: The sensitivity of the test meets WHO standards for detecting the toxin in drinking water.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试的灵敏度满足了世界卫生组织探测饮用水毒物的标准。

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

name: solitude
trans: n. 孤独；隐居；荒僻的地方

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

sentences.english: The statistician diagrammed the statistical results.
sentences.chinese: 统计员用图表来表示统计结果。

sentences.english: I am a statistician, a "cosine academic, " should you find the expression amusing.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名统计学家，“余弦学者”，如果你觉得这个表达有趣的话。

sentences.english: The gig which requires the specialist to capture, sort, and figure out what data are relevant is one part statistician, one part forensic scientist, and one part hacker.
sentences.chinese: 数据科学家们需要获取、分类整理并弄清哪些数据是有用的，他们需要同时扮演统计学家、鉴证专员以及黑客的角色。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works with statistics

name: toss
trans: n. 投掷；摇荡；投掷的距离；掷币赌胜负
vt. 投掷；使…不安；突然抬起；使…上下摇动；与…掷币打赌
vi. 辗转；被乱扔；颠簸；掷钱币决定某事

sentences.english: I’ve been tossing and turning all night.
sentences.chinese: 我一晚上辗转反侧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掷钱币来决定；翻来覆去
detailed_translations.english: to keep changing your position in bed because you cannot sleep

detailed_translations.chinese: 扔，抛，掷；猛抬；拌；掷；使摇动，使颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to throw something, especially something light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 掷钱币来决定； 猛抬头
detailed_translations.english: the act of throwing a coin in the air to decide something, especially who will do something first in a game

sentences.english: No steel rods, no magnets, no computer trickery.
sentences.chinese: 那里没有钢条、没有磁铁也没有电脑欺骗。

sentences.english: But does not necessarily connote dishonesty, insincerity, or trickery.
sentences.chinese: 有可能——但是并不必然地——意味着不诚实， 不诚心或欺骗。

sentences.english: Yet there is no cheating involved in any of the photographs. No steel rods, no magnets, no computer trickery. The only glue he uses is Nature's. Gravity.
sentences.chinese: 然而，其中任何一张照片都没有涉及到欺骗。那里没有钢条、没有磁铁也没有电脑欺骗。他使用的唯一粘合剂是大自然的重力。

detailed_translations.english: the use of tricks to deceive or cheat people

sentences.english: She lived through the turmoil of the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 她经历过法国大革命的混乱之后仍旧活着。

detailed_translations.english: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: uplift
trans: n. 举起，抬起；道德的向上；精神的高涨

sentences.english: This victory was a massive uplift for us.
sentences.chinese: 此次胜利对于我们是一个极大的鼓舞。

detailed_translations.english: to make something higher

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起，抬起；道德的向上；精神的高涨
detailed_translations.english: Uplift is also a noun

name: vigorously
trans: adv. 精神旺盛地，活泼地

name: workaholic
trans: n. 专心工作的人；醉心于工作的人；为免遭辞退而工作过份卖力的人

sentences.english: Eighteen percent of 30-year-olds claim they are workaholics.
sentences.chinese: 18％的30岁的人声称他们是工作狂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心工作的人；醉心于工作的人；为免遭辞退而工作过份卖力的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to work a lot, so that they do not have time to do anything else

name: advent
trans: n. 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节

sentences.english: the advent of the computer
sentences.chinese: 计算机的问世

detailed_translations.chinese: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
detailed_translations.english: the time when something first begins to be widely used

name: amplify
trans: vt. 放大，扩大；增强；详述

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

sentences.english: This is a perennating rhizome from which flowering shoots arise annually.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种每年发芽开花的多年生根茎。

name: aptitude
trans: n. 天资；自然倾向；适宜

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

sentences.english: the biodiversity of the rainforest
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林中的生物多样性

detailed_translations.english: the variety of plants and animals in a particular place

sentences.english: Bullies are often cowards.
sentences.chinese: 恃强凌弱者往往是懦夫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses their strength or power to frighten or hurt someone who is weaker
to threaten to hurt someone or frighten them, especially someone smaller or weaker

sentences.english: The company is building the centre in collaboration with the Institute of Offshore Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合作， 协作； 勾结
detailed_translations.english: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

sentences.english: The problems of traffic congestion will not disappear in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 交通堵塞问题不会很快消失。

detailed_translations.english: If there is congestion in a place, the place is extremely crowded and blocked with traffic or people

name: determinant
trans: n. 决定因素； 行列式

sentences.english: I used this to remember how to calculate the determinant of a matrix.
sentences.chinese: 我就用过这个方法来记住怎么算矩阵中的决定因素。

sentences.english: Another determinant that must be observed by you are interactions and reactions.
sentences.chinese: 另一个你必须观察的决定因素是相互作用和反作用。

detailed_translations.english: something that strongly influences what you do or how you behave

name: discard
trans: n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: distortion
trans: n. 变形； 失真；扭曲；曲解

sentences.english: a distortion of the facts
sentences.chinese: 对事实的歪曲

sentences.english: an environment conducive to learning
sentences.chinese: 有助于学习的环境

detailed_translations.english: if a situation is conducive to something such as work, rest etc, it provides conditions that make it easy for you to work etc

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

name: delicacy
trans: n. 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑

sentences.english: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑
detailed_translations.english: something good to eat that is expensive or rare

name: discredit
trans: n. 怀疑；无信用；名声的败坏

sentences.english: However, I believe in questionings, doubtings, searchings, skepticism, and I discredit credulity or blind faith.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我也相信询问、质疑、探索与怀疑，但拒绝轻信或盲从的信仰。

sentences.english: Lily: : But the interviewers don't think so, they discredit the unmarried women above the normal age have mentality defects, although they are turly bright people.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试官却认为年龄这么大了还没结婚也没男朋友，怀疑她们有心理缺陷，尽管她们确实是人才。 。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect or trust

name: durability
trans: n. 耐久性；坚固；耐用年限

sentences.english: How about the durability of product?
sentences.chinese: 产品的耐久性怎样呢？

sentences.english: Why do we have to do durability test?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么要做耐久性测试?。

sentences.english: Because of the durability of vinyl, products made from this material have a long life span.
sentences.chinese: 由于「乙烯基」的耐久性，这种材料制成的产品具有很长的寿命。

sentences.english: The women prepared, spun, and dyed the wool.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们将羊毛预备、纺线并染色。

sentences.english: hair dye
sentences.chinese: 染发剂

detailed_translations.english: to give something a different colour using a dye
a substance you use to change the colour of your clothes, hair etc

name: exceedingly
trans: adv. 非常；极其；极度地；极端

sentences.english: Thank you. You’ve been exceedingly kind.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢，你真是太好了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely

name: exhaustion
trans: n. 枯竭；耗尽；精疲力竭

sentences.english: We can define burnout as exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把burnout (燃尽)解释为 exhaustion (耗尽)。

sentences.english: Could not this very Socratic way be  a sign of collapse, exhaustion, sickness, and the dissolution of the  anarchic instinct?
sentences.chinese: 这个非常苏格拉底式的方法不能是无法无天的天性的崩塌、耗尽、疾患和解体的一个信号？

detailed_translations.english: when all of something has been used

name: expressive
trans: adj. 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的

sentences.english: You can train people to be more expressive.
sentences.chinese: 你可以培训人们使其更富于表现力。

sentences.english: ...the present fashion for intuitive, expressive painting.
sentences.chinese: …当前凭直觉的、富于表现力的绘画风尚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions

name: feat
trans: n. 功绩，壮举；技艺表演

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

sentences.english: We followed the footprints of a deer in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们追踪雪地里一头鹿的足迹。

detailed_translations.english: a mark made by a foot or shoe

name: fraction
trans: n. 分数；部分；小部分；稍微

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: generously
trans: adv. 慷慨地；宽大地；丰盛地

name: healthcare
trans: n. 医疗保健；健康护理，健康服务；卫生保健

sentences.english: The products are usually used in healthcare area and pharmaceutical area.
sentences.chinese: 产品通常用于在医疗保健领域和医药领域。

sentences.english: Why, with such a great healthcare system that promises the best care to everyone, would a person ever need to consult a search engine for an alternative?
sentences.chinese: 这样一个伟大的医疗保健系统许诺给每个人提供最好的照料，为什么还会有人求助于搜索引擎来寻找替代品？

sentences.english: They are the backbone of rural communities, and in many households they have the key responsibility for food security, education opportunities and healthcare.
sentences.chinese: 她们是农村社区的支柱，而且在许多家庭，她们负有粮食安全、教育机会和医疗保健的主要责任。

name: hyperactivity
trans: n. 极度活跃；活动过度

sentences.english: Simply getting a good night's sleep could reduce levels of hyperactivity and bad behaviour among children, a Finnish study reports.
sentences.chinese: 一项芬兰研究显示，好的睡眠可以简单的降低孩子们过度活动和不好的行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活动过度， 极度活跃

name: icy
trans: adj. 冰冷的；冷淡的；结满冰的

sentences.english: an icy wind
sentences.chinese: 刺骨寒风

sentences.english: The bath water was icy cold.
sentences.chinese: 洗澡水冰冷刺骨。

sentences.english: an icy mountain road
sentences.chinese: 冰封的山路

detailed_translations.english: extremely cold

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

name: impress
trans: n. 印象，印记；特征，痕迹
vt. 盖印；强征；传送；给予某人深刻印象

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: inconsequential
trans: adj. 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的

sentences.english: inconsequential but amusing chatter
sentences.chinese: 无谓但有趣的闲扯

detailed_translations.chinese: 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的
detailed_translations.english: not important

sentences.english: In each of these cases, one of the models evolved independently of the other.
sentences.chinese: 在这里的每种情况下，其中一个模型独立于另一个模型而发展。

sentences.english: Service each copy independently: You can update one copy without affecting any of the other ones.
sentences.chinese: 独立维护每个副本： 可以独立更新某一个副本，而不影响其他的副本。

sentences.english: We have two motors, one on each rear wheel, so the control system has to control each motor independently.
sentences.chinese: 而且我们有两个，每一个后轮都有一个，说以控制系统必须独立地控制每一个电机。

name: inherently
trans: adv. 内在地；固有地；天性地

name: inspect
trans: vi. 进行检查；进行视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: integral
trans: adj. 积分的；完整的，整体的；构成整体所必须的

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: introductory
trans: adj. 引导的，介绍的；开端的

sentences.english: as the chairman said in his introductory remarks
sentences.chinese: 正如主席在开场白中所说的

detailed_translations.english: said or written at the beginning of a book, speech etc in order to explain what it is about

name: iron
trans: adj. 铁的；残酷的；刚强的

sentences.english: the iron and steel industry
sentences.chinese: 钢铁工业

sentences.english: a driveway with large iron gates
sentences.chinese: 安装了大铁门的私家车道

sentences.english: the absorption of iron from food
sentences.chinese: 对食物中铁的吸收

sentences.english: ...a man of icy nerve and iron will.
sentences.chinese: …一个头脑冷静、意志坚强的男人。

detailed_translations.english: a common hard metal that is used to make steel, is  magnetic  , and is found in very small quantities in food and blood. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Fe
to make clothes smooth using an iron
You can use iron to describe the character or behaviour of someone who is very firm in their decisions and actions, or who can control their feelings well

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

sentences.english: Sally keeps her make-up kit in her bag.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉把化妆包放在手提包里。

sentences.english: a bike repair kit
sentences.chinese: 一套自行车修理工具

sentences.english: a shaving kit
sentences.chinese: 一套剃须用具

sentences.english: a drum kit
sentences.chinese: 一套架子鼓

detailed_translations.english: a set of tools, equipment etc that you use for a particular purpose or activity

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

sentences.english: a lonely old man
sentences.chinese: 一个孤单的老人

sentences.english: Don’t you get lonely being on your own all day?
sentences.chinese: 你整天独自一人不感到寂寞吗？

detailed_translations.english: unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to

name: loop
trans: n. 环；圈；弯曲部分；翻筋斗
vt. 使成环；以环连结；使翻筋斗

sentences.english: He looped the rope over the wood.
sentences.chinese: 他把绳子打了环系在木头上。

detailed_translations.english: to fly a plane up and around in a circle so that the plane is  upside down  for a time
a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape

sentences.english: magical powers
sentences.chinese: 魔力

detailed_translations.english: relating to magic or able to do magic

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: massively
trans: adv. 大量地；沉重地；庄严地

name: mechanical
trans: adj. 机械的；力学的；呆板的；无意识的；手工操作的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: molecular
trans: adj.  分子的；由分子组成的

sentences.english: ...the molecular structure of fuel.
sentences.chinese: …燃料的分子结构。

detailed_translations.english: Molecular means relating to or involving molecules

name: naturalize
trans: vt. 移植；使入国籍；采纳

sentences.english: Immigration officials were allowed to enter the country and naturalize soldiers under the 1942 law.
sentences.chinese: 根据1942年法，移民局官员可以让士兵进入该国并加入该国国籍。

detailed_translations.english: if someone born outside a particular country is naturalized, they become a citizen of that country

sentences.english: The society publishes a newsletter twice a year.
sentences.chinese: 该社团一年出版两次简报。

detailed_translations.english: a short written report of news about a club, organization etc that is sent regularly to people who are interested

name: omit
trans: vt. 省略；遗漏；删除；疏忽

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

sentences.english: They need to optimize the use of available resources.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要充分利用手上的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the way that something is done or used so that it is as effective as possible

name: outrageous
trans: adj. 粗暴的；可恶的；令人吃惊的

sentences.english: By diplomatic standards, this was outrageous behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 按外交标准，这是不可接受的行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴的；可恶的；令人吃惊的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as outrageous, you are emphasizing that it is unacceptable or very shocking

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

name: prescription
trans: adj. 凭处方方可购买的

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: proclaim
trans: vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: provoke
trans: vt. 驱使；激怒；煽动；惹起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: punctuality
trans: n. 严守时间；正确；规矩

sentences.english: The airline hopes to improve punctuality next year.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司希望明年在准点上做出改善。

detailed_translations.english: Punctuality is the quality of being punctual

sentences.english: Large scale revolutions attempting to change all the institutions of society at once make it impossible for anyone –including the revolutionaries –to plan rationally.
sentences.chinese: 企图立即改变社会的制度而引发的大规模革命使得所有人都不能理性的计划，包括那些革命者的。

name: regulatory
trans: adj. 管理的；控制的；调整的

sentences.english: Perhaps the best reason for regulators to be suspicious about innovation is that so much of it in the modern world is aimed at facilitating regulatory and tax arbitrage.
sentences.chinese: 监管者之所以对创新怀有疑虑，最关键的原因可能在于，现代社会中太多创新的目的都是为监管和税收套利提供便利。

detailed_translations.english: a regulatory authority has the official power to control an activity and to make sure that it is done in a satisfactory way

sentences.english: I can assure you of the reliability of the information.
sentences.chinese: 我可以向你保证这消息是可靠的。

sentences.english: You have to work at it and design it in to your systems from the beginning, just like you have to design in scalability, performance, reliability and security.
sentences.chinese: 您从一开始就得学习它并将其设计到您的系统中，就像您在可伸缩性、性能、可靠性和安全性方面进行的设计一样。

sentences.english: How will that affect reliability and other factors?
sentences.chinese: 将如何影响可靠性和其他因素？

name: respectively
trans: adv. 分别地；各自地，独自地

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

name: revelation
trans: n. 启示；揭露；出乎意料的事；被揭露的真相

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: scary
trans: adj. （事物）可怕的；恐怖的；吓人的；（人）提心吊胆的；引起惊慌的；胆小的

sentences.english: a scary moment
sentences.chinese: 恐怖的一刻

sentences.english: a scary movie
sentences.chinese: 恐怖片

sentences.english: The book is both scary and funny.
sentences.chinese: 这本书既恐怖又有趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的， 骇人的； 惊慌的， 害怕的； 胆小的， 易受惊的
detailed_translations.english: frightening

name: sceptical
trans: adj. 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理； 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: shortcut
trans: n. 捷径；被切短的东西

sentences.english: I tried to take a shortcut and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 我试着走近路，结果迷路了。

sentences.english: Fame can be a shortcut to love and money.
sentences.chinese: 名望可以是得到爱情和金钱的捷径。

detailed_translations.english: a quicker way of getting somewhere than the usual route

sentences.english: She swam and sunbathed, went sightseeing and relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 她游泳，晒日光浴，观光，放松。

name: sphere
trans: vt. 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

sentences.chinese: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

name: subscription
trans: n. 捐献；订阅；订金；签署

sentences.chinese: 你随时可以取消订阅。

sentences.chinese: 一个认真负责的教师可能会想着把工作带回家去做。

sentences.chinese: B：当一个部件达到了变形的极限时，就会发生断裂。

sentences.chinese: 本章提供关于有限元模型建立、光学元件和光学结构的运动变形的预测分析方法方面的指导。

sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

sentences.chinese: 需要特别注意的是偏差阈值参数和空间移位参数。
