sentences.english: Currently, disposables account for about 80% to 85% of the $3 billion-plus annual diaper market.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一次性尿布占年销售额30多亿美元的尿布市场的80%至85%左右。

detailed_translations.english: available to be used

detailed_translations.chinese: 一次性物品， 不回收物品
detailed_translations.english: Disposable products can be referred to as disposables

name: dispose
trans: vi. 处理；安排；（能够）决定

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

name: disposition
trans: n. 处置； 性情； 部署；倾向

sentences.english: The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性格；排列,部署；倾向,意向
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

name: divert
trans: vt. 转移；使…欢娱；使…转向

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: embody
trans: vt. 体现，使具体化；具体表达

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: enrichment
trans: n. 丰富；改进；肥沃；发财致富

sentences.english: ...the enrichment of society.
sentences.chinese: …社会的富足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发财致富, 丰富, 肥沃
detailed_translations.english: Enrichment is the act of enriching someone or something or the state of being enriched

sentences.english: And we will set our sights on the eradication of extreme poverty in our time.
sentences.chinese: 我们还将力争在我们这个时代根除极端贫困的现象。

sentences.english: After meeting with Rotary's delegation, Uttar Pradesh's chief minister vowed to personally monitor eradication progress in the state.
sentences.chinese: 北方邦的省长在与扶轮的代表团会面之后，誓言亲自监督该省根除工作的进度。

sentences.english: From that point of view, why not extend our control even into our sleep and rewrite our painful dreams in a general program of nightmare eradication?
sentences.chinese: 从这个角度上看，为什么不用一个通用的程序进入到我们的睡眠，改写使我们痛苦的梦境，将梦魇连根拔除？

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: exclaim
trans: vi. 呼喊，惊叫；大声叫嚷

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

sentences.english: You have to grant us control explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 你们必须允许我们明确地控制。

sentences.english: Tell them explicitly you want to continue the friendship.
sentences.chinese: 明确地告诉他们你想继续这段友谊。

sentences.english: Therefore, you need to include these in your source files explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 因此，您需要将这些都明确地包含进源文件中。

sentences.english: The new rocket was extensively tested and debugged by the army.
sentences.chinese: 这种新式火箭由军方进行了广泛的测试和调试。

sentences.english: Dr Alloway, from the University of Stirling in Scotland, has extensively studied working memory and believes it to be far more important to success and happiness than IQ.
sentences.chinese: 来自苏格兰的斯特灵大学阿洛韦博士，已经广泛的研究“工作记忆”，并认为它是比智商更为重要对于成功和幸福来说。

name: extravagant
trans: adj. 奢侈的；浪费的；过度的；放纵的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: fallout
trans: n. 原子尘； 放射性尘埃；原子尘微粒回降；附带结果

sentences.english: The political fallout of the affair cost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件的政治影响使他丢了工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射微尘, 原子尘, 附带结果
detailed_translations.english: the results of a particular event, especially when they are unexpected

name: flawed
trans: adj. 有缺陷的；有瑕疵的；有裂纹的

sentences.english: a flawed concept
sentences.chinese: 有错误的观念

detailed_translations.chinese: 有缺陷的；有瑕疵的；有裂纹的
detailed_translations.english: spoiled by having mistakes, weaknesses, or by being damaged

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: fragility
trans: n. 脆弱； 易碎性；虚弱

sentences.english: If he was ill, why didn't anyone do something about his fragility?
sentences.chinese: 假如他生病了，为什么没有任何人为他的脆弱做些什么？

name: framework
trans: n. 框架，骨架；结构，构架

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

sentences.english: Frankly, I think the Internet is overrated.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地说，我认为因特网被高估了。

sentences.english: His behaviour was frankly disgraceful.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为老实说是可耻的。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are saying what you really think about something

name: garment
trans: n. 衣服，服装；外表，外观

sentences.english: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

sentences.english: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing

name: glamorous
trans: adj. 迷人的，富有魅力的

sentences.english: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
sentences.chinese: 她生活奢华，充满刺激。

sentences.english: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里最繁华的街区

sentences.english: On television, she looks so glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有魅力的, 迷人的
detailed_translations.english: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

sentences.english: a pair of gloves
sentences.chinese: 一副手套

sentences.english: boxing gloves
sentences.chinese: 拳击手套

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: headway
trans: n. 前进；进步；航行速度；间隔时间

sentences.english: Stormy weather stopped the ship from making headway.
sentences.chinese: 船在暴风雨天气里不能向前开。

detailed_translations.chinese: 前进；进步；航行速度；间隔时间
detailed_translations.english: to move forwards – used especially when this is slow or difficult

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；增高；加强；使更显著

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

sentences.english: India tolerated dissent, but it also tolerated inefficiency, disease and illiteracy.
sentences.chinese: 印度容许异议，但同时它也容忍了无能、疾病与文盲。

sentences.english: Tackling corruption would be the fastest way to address problems like poverty, disease, and illiteracy, he contended.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，反腐败可能是解决诸如贫困、疾病和文盲等问题的最快途径。

sentences.english: This great institution must work for great purposes -- to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance, and poverty and despair.
sentences.chinese: 这个伟大的机构必须努力达到伟大的目的──使人们摆脱暴政与暴力、饥饿与疾病、文盲与愚昧、贫困与绝望。

detailed_translations.english: Illiteracy is the state of not knowing how to read or write

name: illogical
trans: adj. 不合逻辑的；不合常理的

sentences.english: illogical and unreasonable fear
sentences.chinese: 毫无道理的惧怕

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合逻辑的；不合常理的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or reasonable

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: incomplete
trans: adj. 不完全的； 不完备的

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I do not have the information because our records are incomplete.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，由于我们的记录不完整，我无法提供有关资料。

sentences.english: an incomplete process
sentences.chinese: 未完成的工序

detailed_translations.english: not having everything that should be there, or not completely finished

name: inconsistent
trans: adj. 不一致的；前后矛盾的

sentences.english: The accounts of the witnesses are inconsistent.
sentences.chinese: 几位目击者的说法不一致。

detailed_translations.english: two statements that are inconsistent cannot both be true

name: indecision
trans: n. 优柔寡断；犹豫不决

sentences.english: There were weeks of indecision about who would go and when.
sentences.chinese: 关于谁去和什么时候去的问题几个星期以来一直悬而未决。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to decide what to do

name: indication
trans: n. 指示，指出；迹象；象征

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

sentences.english: He is an innovator in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个领域的革新者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

sentences.english: to input text/data/figures
sentences.chinese: 把文本 / 数据 / 数字输入计算机

sentences.english: data input
sentences.chinese: 数据输入

detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer
the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

name: intensify
trans: vt. 使加强，使强化；使变激烈

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: intermediary
trans: n. 中间人；仲裁者；调解者；媒介物
adj. 中间的；媒介的；中途的

sentences.english: Often the initial topology does not call for another intermediary, so this becomes a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 通常，最初的拓扑结构并不要求另外的中介，因此这成为了一个好的选择。

detailed_translations.chinese: 中间人；仲裁者；调解者；媒介物
detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that tries to help two other people or groups to agree with each other

sentences.english: The water in Lake Powell is used to irrigate the area.
sentences.chinese: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

detailed_translations.english: to supply land or crops with water

sentences.english: Can you lengthen this skirt for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能帮我把这条裙子改长？

sentences.english: The days lengthened as summer approached.
sentences.chinese: 随着夏天来临，白天变长了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something longer or to become longer

sentences.english: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，我军解放了这座城市。

detailed_translations.english: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control

sentences.english: Nanny put on a shawl and told the girls to do likewise.
sentences.chinese: 南妮披上披肩，并叫女孩们也这样做。

sentences.english: The clams were delicious. Likewise, the eggplant was excellent.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊味道鲜美，茄子也同样美味。

sentences.english: ‘You’re always welcome at our house.’ ‘Likewise.’
sentences.chinese: “欢迎你随时来我家做客。”“你也一样。

detailed_translations.english: in the same way

name: materialize
trans: vt. 使具体化，使有形；使突然出现；使重物质而轻精神
vi. 实现，成形；突然出现

sentences.english: Problems were expected, but they never materialized.
sentences.chinese: 估计会有问题，但一直没有发生。

sentences.english: The money we had been promised failed to materialize .
sentences.chinese: 答应给我们的钱并没有兑现。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or appear in the way that you expected

name: melt
trans: vt. 使融化；使熔化；使软化；使感动

sentences.english: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.english: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

detailed_translations.english: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

name: mercy
trans: n. 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

name: messy
trans: adj. 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.english: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的
detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

sentences.english: Even harmless drugs can be misused.
sentences.chinese: 即使是无毒副作用的药物也有使用不当的时候。

sentences.english: The term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
sentences.chinese: “精神分裂症”这个术语经常被误用。

sentences.english: There is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心裁判员可能会滥用权力。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results
the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

name: nevertheless
trans: adv. 然而，不过；虽然如此

sentences.english: What you said was true. It was, nevertheless, a little unkind.
sentences.chinese: 你说的都是实话，只不过有点刻薄。

sentences.english: Although the market has been flat, residential property costs remain high. Nevertheless, the fall-off in demand has had an impact on resale values.
sentences.chinese: 尽管市场一直疲软，房价持续偏高。然而需求的减少还是对二手房价格产生了影响。

detailed_translations.english: You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.
in spite of a fact that you have just mentioned

name: nightmare
trans: n. 恶梦；梦魇般的经历

sentences.english: a recurring nightmare
sentences.chinese: 一再出现的噩梦

detailed_translations.english: a very frightening dream

name: notoriously
trans: adv. 众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

sentences.english: Derrida famously, notoriously, said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
sentences.chinese: 德里达著名地，恶名昭彰地，说道，文本之外什么都没有“,是吧，当然，他意思就是说，需要考虑的只有文本。

name: numerical
trans: adj. 数值的；数字的；用数字表示的（等于numeric）

sentences.english: a numerical code
sentences.chinese: 数字密码

sentences.english: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage (= the fact that they had more players than the other team ).
sentences.chinese: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。

sentences.english: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
sentences.chinese: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

detailed_translations.english: expressed or considered in numbers

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: obedient
trans: adj. 顺从的，服从的；孝顺的

sentences.english: an obedient child
sentences.chinese: 听话的孩子

sentences.english: citizens who are obedient to the law
sentences.chinese: 遵纪守法的公民

detailed_translations.english: always doing what you are told to do, or what the law, a rule etc says you must do

name: overshadow
trans: vt. 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩

sentences.english: "If you can stop the enzymes involved in that process with a small molecule or chemical," says Dunman, "that chemical could be an antibiotic.

trans: vt. 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名

sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

name: haven
trans: n. 港口；避难所，安息所
vt. 为……提供避难处；安置……于港中

sentences.english: ...Lake Baringo, a freshwater haven for a mixed variety of birds.
sentences.chinese: …百瑞高湖，一个适合各种鸟类的淡水栖息地。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

detailed_translations.chinese: 为……提供避难处；安置……于港中

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: medication
trans: n. 药物；药物治疗；药物处理

sentences.english: When somebody comes for treatment I always ask them if they are on any medication.
sentences.chinese: 有人来治疗时，我总是会问他们是否在服药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 药物；药物治疗；药物处理
detailed_translations.english: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

name: obsess
trans: vt. 迷住，缠住；使…着迷；使…困扰

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: pest
trans: n. 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人

sentences.english: a chemical used in pest control
sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

detailed_translations.chinese: 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

name: redundant
trans: adj. 多余的，过剩的；被解雇的，失业的；冗长的，累赘的

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: refuge
trans: vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: scenario
trans: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: simultaneous
trans: adj. 同时的；联立的；同时发生的

sentences.english: They grabbed each other’s hands in simultaneous panic.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩同时惊慌起来，相互抓住对方的手。

sentences.english: Up to twenty users can have simultaneous access to the system.
sentences.chinese: 最多可有20名用户同时登该系统。

sentences.english: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation (= immediate translation, as the person is speaking ) into English.
sentences.chinese: 这些演讲将作现场直播，并配有英语同声传译。

detailed_translations.english: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: array
trans: n. 数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: bureaucracy
trans: n. 官僚主义；官僚机构；官僚政治

sentences.english: the reduction of unnecessary bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 消除不必要的官僚体制

detailed_translations.english: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

name: carbohydrate
trans: n.  碳水化合物； 糖类

sentences.english: Around one third of our meals should be based on carbohydrate, with roughly one half of these grains being whole.
sentences.chinese: 我们每餐食物应当差不多有三分之一是碳水化合物，大概有一半谷物食品为全麦的。

sentences.english: There have been no studies of the effects of a low carbohydrate diet on pregnancy, so its effect on the fetus, if any, are unknown.
sentences.chinese: 目前为止还没有关于怀孕时低碳水化合物饮食影响的研究，因此如果对胎儿有什么影响也是不知道的。

sentences.english: The reason for this is that carbohydrate consumption stimulates insulin production, which aids the production of muscle glycogen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为是碳水化合物的消耗刺激了胰岛素的分泌，后者对于肌肉糖原产生有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is in foods such as sugar, bread, and potatoes, which provides your body with heat and energy and which consists of oxygen,  hydrogen  , and  carbon

name: civic
trans: adj. 市的；公民的，市民的

sentences.chinese: 杰克逊那天与当地的宗教领袖和市领导会面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a town or city

name: cricket
trans: n. 板球，板球运动；蟋蟀

sentences.english: The boy traded his knife for a cricket bat.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩用他的刀子换了一个板球棒。

sentences.english: He angrily stomped his cricket after failing the fight.
sentences.chinese: 比赛失败后，他生气地踏死了他的蟋蟀。

sentences.english: He was pressganged into playing in the charity cricket match.
sentences.chinese: 他是被强拉去参加这场板球义赛的。

detailed_translations.english: a game between two teams of 11 players in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running between two sets of three sticks

name: default
trans: n. 违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值
vt. 不履行；不参加（比赛等）；对…处以缺席裁判
vi. 拖欠；不履行；不到场

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: diesel
trans: n. 柴油机；柴油；（俚）健康的身体
adj. 内燃机传动的；供内燃机用的
n. 迪赛（意大利时装品牌）

sentences.english: a 1.9 litre diesel engine
sentences.chinese: 1.9升柴油发动机

detailed_translations.chinese: 柴油机；柴油；（俚）健康的身体
detailed_translations.english: a type of heavy oil used instead of petrol in engines, especially in trucks, buses, and trains

detailed_translations.chinese: 内燃机传动的；供内燃机用的

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: epic
trans: n. 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: foster
trans: vt. 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: hectic
trans: adj. 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的

sentences.chinese: 我忙乱了一整天。

sentences.english: a hectic social life
sentences.chinese: 繁忙的社交生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
detailed_translations.english: very busy or full of activity

sentences.english: Her younger brother hovered in the background watching us.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟在后面走来走去，观察着我们。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird, insect, or  helicopter  hovers, it stays in one place in the air

sentences.chinese: 轮船撞到冰山上。

sentences.english: Their ship circled the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 他们的船绕过了冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

v. 使负债；使受恩惠（indebt的过去分词）

sentences.english: the 17 most heavily indebted nations
sentences.chinese: 17个负债最重的国家

detailed_translations.english: owing money to someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 使负债；使受恩惠（indebt的过去分词）

sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

sentences.chinese: 肾脏移植

sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
sentences.chinese: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of time that someone or something lives

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；原始的；仿中世纪的；老式的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: metaphor
trans: n. 暗喻，隐喻；比喻说法

sentences.english: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
sentences.chinese: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。

sentences.english: a very creative use of metaphor
sentences.chinese: 隐喻的独到运用

sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

name: miniature
trans: n. 缩图；微型画；微型图画绘画术

sentences.english: She’s her mother in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 她是她母亲的缩影。

sentences.english: a miniature railway
sentences.chinese: 微型铁路

detailed_translations.english: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
much smaller than normal

sentences.english: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。

sentences.english: a multitude of possible interpretations
sentences.chinese: 种种可能的解释

name: olive
trans: n. 橄榄；橄榄树；橄榄色

sentences.chinese: 一片橄榄树林

sentences.english: They are handsome with dark, shining hair, olive skin and fine brown eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他们很帅，有着乌黑闪亮的头发，黄褐色的皮肤，迷人的棕色眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: a small bitter egg-shaped black or green fruit, used as food and for making oil
If someone has olive skin, the colour of their skin is yellowish brown

name: profile
trans: n. 侧面；轮廓；外形；剖面；简况
vt. 描…的轮廓；扼要描述

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: snap
trans: n. 猛咬；劈啪声；突然折断
vt. 突然折断，拉断；猛咬；啪地关上
vi. 咬；厉声说；咯嗒一声关上

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

name: stun
trans: n. 昏迷；打昏；惊倒；令人惊叹的事物
vt. 使震惊；打昏；给以深刻的印象

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: tactic
trans: adj. 按顺序的，依次排列的

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: tempt
trans: vt. 诱惑；引起；冒…的风险；使感兴趣

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

sentences.english: fumes from a toxic waste dump
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

detailed_translations.english: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

sentences.english: We all like the tranquility of the country life.
sentences.chinese: 我们都喜欢乡村生活的宁静。

sentences.english: For this brings not only the tranquility which comes from doing well, but also that which comes from doing few things.
sentences.chinese: 因为这不仅带来由于做事适当而产生的宁静，而且带来由于做很少的事而产生的宁静。

sentences.english: And while I love my family to death, this time of tranquility is one of absolute bliss for me.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我对我的家庭爱得要死，但这片刻的宁静绝对是我的幸福之一。

name: vocal
trans: adj. 歌唱的；声音的，有声的

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

name: wrestle
trans: vt. 与摔跤；与…搏斗；使劲搬动

sentences.english: They run races; they wrestle; and sometimes they have mock fights together.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁参加各种赛跑，摔跤，有时还在一起模拟战斗。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone by holding them and pulling or pushing them

name: activate
trans: vt. 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

sentences.english: ...chimpanzees and other apes.
sentences.chinese: …黑猩猩和其他猿。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that is similar to a monkey but has no tail or only a very short tail
to copy the way someone speaks or behaves in order to make fun of them

sentences.english: ...a wealthy southern aristocrat.
sentences.chinese: …一位富有的南方贵族。

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

sentences.english: The atlas was published by our company.
sentences.chinese: 这个地图集是由我们公司出版的。

sentences.english: The atlas should help the eradication fight by letting health officials know just where the problem areas are.
sentences.chinese: 而这些地图集刚好能帮助卫生局高清楚问题地区所在，然后将虫虫们斩草除根。

sentences.english: He also feared that a map in the atlas, along with news accounts repeating an error in the news release, could pull climate scientists into another vortex of damaging controversy.
sentences.chinese: 他还担心新闻评述会同地图集里的地图一道，在新闻发布的时候，一而再再而三地犯着同一个错误，反而将气象学家们拉入争辩的漩涡之中。

detailed_translations.english: a book containing maps, especially of the whole world

name: brew
trans: vi. 酿酒；被冲泡；即将发生

sentences.english: Every beer on the menu was brewed locally.
sentences.chinese: 酒单上的所有啤酒都是本地酿造的。

detailed_translations.english: to make beer
to make beer
a drink that is brewed, especially tea

name: butt
trans: n. 屁股；烟头；笑柄；靶垛；粗大的一端

sentences.english: a baby’s soft little butt
sentences.chinese: 宝宝软软的小屁股

detailed_translations.chinese: 屁股；烟头；笑柄；靶垛；粗大的一端
detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that you sit on
to hit or push against something or someone with your head

name: casualty
trans: n. 意外事故；伤亡人员；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: chronic
trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: chunk
trans: n. 大块；矮胖的人或物

sentences.english: ice chunks
sentences.chinese: 大冰块

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分
detailed_translations.english: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

sentences.english: To investigate, his team injected cocaine, capsaicin or both at once into the abdomens of several groups of about 30 mice.
sentences.chinese: 他的团队将辣椒素或可卡因中的一种，或同时将两种注射进几组老鼠的腹部，每组约30只。

sentences.english: Then the researchers repeated the experiment, but this time they injected rats with a dose of cocaine or morphine on one side and with a neutral saline solution on the other.
sentences.chinese: 然后，研究人员重复这项实验，但是这次他们给一边的小白鼠注射小剂量的可卡因或吗啡，而另一边注射中性盐水。

detailed_translations.english: a drug, usually in the form of a white powder, that is taken illegally for pleasure or used in some medical situations to prevent pain

name: coincide
trans: vi. 一致，符合；同时发生
vi. (在性格、品质等方面)完全一致，相符

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

sentences.english: They'd conspired to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾合谋推翻政府。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly plan with someone else to do something illegal

name: constraint
trans: n.  约束；局促，态度不自然；强制

sentences.english: the constraints of family life
sentences.chinese: 家庭生活的约束

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制
detailed_translations.english: something that limits your freedom to do what you want

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会合， 互相靠拢； 聚集， 集中； 趋近
detailed_translations.english: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing

name: crude
trans: adj. 粗糙的；天然的，未加工的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

sentences.english: Learning is a cumulative process.
sentences.chinese: 学习是个逐渐积累的过程。

detailed_translations.english: increasing gradually as more of something is added or happens

name: degradation
trans: n. 退化；降格，降级；堕落

sentences.english: ...air pollution, traffic congestion, and the steady degradation of our quality of life.
sentences.chinese: …空气污染、交通阻塞以及我们生活质量的持续恶化。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: dissertation
trans: n. 论文，专题；学术演讲

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

sentences.english: A duplicate copy should be made for the county record office.
sentences.chinese: 应该制作一个副本呈交县档案室。

sentences.english: a duplicate key
sentences.chinese: 配制的钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的， 复制的
detailed_translations.english: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的东西，复制品
detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制， 复印； 重复
detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

name: dwell
trans: vi. 居住；存在于；细想某事

sentences.english: They dwelt in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在森林里。

sentences.english: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.
sentences.chinese: 你是错了，不过不必老是想着这事儿。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

name: entail
trans: vt. 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

name: envelope
trans: n. 信封，封皮；包膜； 包层；包迹

sentences.english: envelopes and stamps
sentences.chinese: 信封和邮票

sentences.english: She tore open the envelope and frantically read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她撕开信封慌忙看信。

sentences.english: He got a job stuffing envelopes (= filling them with letters ) at the campaign headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他找了一份在竞选总部装信封的工作。

detailed_translations.english: a thin paper cover in which you put and send a letter

name: equity
trans: n. 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

name: esteem
trans: vt. 尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: expire
trans: vi. 期满；终止；死亡；呼气

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

sentences.english: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸟被关了起来，到现在它都非常狂躁。

detailed_translations.english: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

name: grid
trans: n. 网格；格子，栅格；输电网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: hop
trans: n. 蹦跳,跳跃；跳舞；一次飞行的距离

sentences.english: a little girl hopping and skipping
sentences.chinese: 一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩

detailed_translations.chinese: 单足跳跃，单足跳行；齐足跳跃，齐足跳行
detailed_translations.english: to move by jumping on one foot
to move by jumping on one foot
a short jump

name: illiterate
trans: adj. 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将来临的；迫近的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

name: irritate
trans: vi. 引起恼怒，引起不愉快

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: legitimate
trans: adj. 合法的；正当的；合理的；正统的
vt. 使合法；认为正当（等于legitimize）

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: metropolitan
trans: adj. 大都市的；大主教辖区的；宗主国的
n. 大城市人；大主教；宗主国的公民

sentences.english: a metropolitan area of South Australia
sentences.chinese: 南澳大利亚的一个都市区

sentences.english: ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教

detailed_translations.english: relating or belonging to a very large city
a metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.

sentences.english: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

name: nominee
trans: n. 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

sentences.english: the Democratic Party presidential nominee
sentences.chinese: 民主党被提名的总统候选人

detailed_translations.chinese: 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区非常漂亮，然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。

sentences.english: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 这些画复杂难懂，不过还是不乏吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽管如此， 依然， 然而
detailed_translations.english: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: orthodox
trans: adj. 正统的；传统的；惯常的；东正教的
n. 正统的人；正统的事物

sentences.english: orthodox medical treatments
sentences.chinese: 传统疗法

sentences.english: He challenged the orthodox views on education.
sentences.chinese: 他对传统的教育观念提出了质疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正统的；传统的；惯常的；东正教的
detailed_translations.english: orthodox ideas, methods, or behaviour are accepted by most people to be correct and right

name: outfit
trans: n. 机构；用具；全套装备

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

name: owl
trans: n. 猫头鹰；枭；惯于晚上活动的人

sentences.english: Some of the more extreme contacts give you "cat eyes" or how about "owl eyes"?
sentences.chinese: 一些更酷的隐形眼镜可以给你一双"猫眼"或者是"猫头鹰的眼睛"。

sentences.english: A great owl, with yellow sulphurous eyes, called to him by his name, but he made it no answer.
sentences.chinese: 一只长着黄色硫磺的巨大眼睛的猫头鹰，呼唤着他的名字，但他没有应答。

detailed_translations.english: a bird with large eyes that hunts at night

sentences.english: iron oxide
sentences.chinese: 氧化铁

detailed_translations.english: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

sentences.english: the Korean peninsula
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜半岛

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but joined to a large area of land

name: plausible
trans: adj. 貌似可信的，花言巧语的；貌似真实的，貌似有理的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .

sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

sentences.english: The seats are allotted to the candidates who have won the most votes.
sentences.chinese: 这些席位被分配给了赢得了最多选票的候选人。

detailed_translations.english: to use a particular amount of time for something, or give a particular share of money, space etc to someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Allot)人名；(英)阿洛特；(西)阿略特；(法)阿洛

name: alloy
trans: vt. 使成合金；使减低成色

sentences.english: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
sentences.chinese: 黄铜是铜和锌的合金。

detailed_translations.english: to mix one metal with another
a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

name: apt
trans: adj. 恰当的；有…倾向的；灵敏的

sentences.english: ‘Love at first sight’ is a very apt description of how he felt when he saw her.
sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

sentences.english: She had taught him French and he had been an apt student.
sentences.chinese: 她教过他法语，他一直是个聪慧的学生。

detailed_translations.english: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose

sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: articulate
trans: adj. 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
vt. 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
vi. 发音；清楚地讲话；用关节连接起来

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

sentences.chinese: 这份报告认为儿童哮喘发病率上升是因为污染加剧。

sentences.english: He ascribed his failure to bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 他认为自己的失败是运气不好。

detailed_translations.english: to claim that something is caused by a particular person, situation etc

name: baffle
trans: vt. 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制

sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

sentences.english: In April 655, Osman’s palace was besieged by rebels.
sentences.chinese: 公元655年4月，奥斯曼的宫殿遭到叛军围攻。

detailed_translations.english: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control

name: bleak
trans: adj. 阴冷的；荒凉的，无遮蔽的；黯淡的，无希望的；冷酷的；单调的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

sentences.english: Their economy is teetering on the brink of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 他们的经济正摇摆于崩溃的边缘。

detailed_translations.english: a situation when you are almost in a new situation, usually a bad one

trans: adj. 敏锐的，活泼的，轻快的；凛冽的
vt. 使……活泼；使……轻快；使……兴旺
vi. 活跃起来；变得轻快

sentences.english: a brisk walk
sentences.chinese: 轻快的行走

sentences.english: They set off at a brisk pace .
sentences.chinese: 他们踏着轻快的步伐上路了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的， 生气勃勃的； 兴隆的， 繁忙活跃的； 寒冷而清新的
detailed_translations.english: quick and full of energy

name: buzz

vi. 作嗡嗡声；东奔西忙
n. 网络口碑（消费者或网民对于品牌、产品等广告主在乎的事情在网上发出的各种声音）

sentences.english: a loud buzzing noise
sentences.chinese: 很大的嗡嗡声

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出嗡嗡声；忙乱，急行；发出嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: to make a continuous sound, like the sound of a  bee

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗡嗡声； 嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: a continuous noise like the sound of a  bee

sentences.english: The explorers paddled their canoe cautiously upstream.
sentences.chinese: 探险者们谨慎地把独木舟向上游划去。

sentences.english: At a summer job working as park naturalists that year, I flipped the canoe Air and I were paddling and we had to push it to shore.
sentences.chinese: 那年我在公园里做暑期兼职，我把独木舟翻转个身，然后我们一起合力将它推到岸边，这样我们就可以划船了。

sentences.english: I remember the first time I visited a village in Vietnam, in 1995: we endured hours and hours of rutty roads or long hours in a canoe to reach project sites.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1995年第一次访问越南一个村落，我们捱过很多小时的路途颠簸、坐了很多小时的独木舟，才到达项目的所在地。

detailed_translations.english: to travel by canoe
a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

name: canvas
trans: vt. 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

sentences.english: a canvas bag
sentences.chinese: 帆布包

detailed_translations.english: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

sentences.english: ...a woollen cape.
sentences.chinese: …一件羊毛披肩。

sentences.english: Cape Cod
sentences.chinese: 科德角

detailed_translations.english: a long loose piece of clothing without sleeves that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

name: capsule
trans: n. 胶囊； 蒴果；太空舱；小容器

sentences.english: a space capsule orbiting the Earth
sentences.chinese: 沿地球轨道飞行的太空舱

detailed_translations.chinese: 胶囊； 航天舱， 密封舱
detailed_translations.english: a plastic container shaped like a very small tube with medicine inside that you swallow whole

name: caption
trans: n. 标题；字幕；说明；逮捕
vt. 加上说明；加上标题

sentences.english: The local paper featured me standing on a stepladder with a caption, "Wendy climbs the ladder to success."
sentences.chinese: 当地的报纸刊登了一幅我站在活梯上的特写，下面写着：“温迪登上了成功之梯。”

detailed_translations.english: words printed above or below a picture in a book or newspaper or on a television screen to explain what the picture is showing

name: carving
trans: n. 雕刻；雕刻品；雕刻术

sentences.english: ...a wood carving of a human hand.
sentences.chinese: …一尊人手木雕。

detailed_translations.english: an object or pattern made by cutting a shape in wood or stone for decoration

name: chamber
trans: n. （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所
adj. 室内的；私人的，秘密的
vt. 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

sentences.english: a combustion chamber
sentences.chinese: 燃烧室

sentences.english: The heart has four chambers.
sentences.chinese: 心脏有四个腔。

detailed_translations.chinese: （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

name: cluster
trans: vt. 使聚集；聚集在某人的周围

sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: comic
trans: n. 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
adj. 喜剧的；滑稽的；有趣的

sentences.english: a comic novel
sentences.chinese: 滑稽小说

detailed_translations.english: amusing you and making you want to laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
detailed_translations.english: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

sentences.chinese: 你的嘴唇就像是波斯王国的弯弓，那是一张涂上朱砂的弯弓，那是一张头上镶嵌珊瑚的弯弓。

sentences.english: I believe they are doing a good job with that. How about the coral? Is it really as beautiful as they say?
sentences.chinese: 我相信他们是在做好事。对了，珊瑚怎么样？它们真的就像人们说的那么漂亮吗？

sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

sentences.chinese: 法式烹饪

sentences.english: vegetarian cuisine
sentences.chinese: 素食烹饪

detailed_translations.english: a particular style of cooking

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

trans: vt. 谴责；告发；公然抨击；通告废除

sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

sentences.chinese: 火车在一片偏僻的山区脱轨，导致至少六人死亡，约二十人受伤。

sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

sentences.chinese: 南希想知道她生活在英格兰又嫁给梅尔文是不是命运的安排。

sentences.english: We are masters of our own destiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们是自己命运的主人。

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: deter
trans: vt. 制止，阻止；使打消念头

sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: divert
trans: vt. 转移；使…欢娱；使…转向

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

sentences.english: ...the dome of the Capitol.
sentences.chinese: …国会大厦的穹顶。

detailed_translations.english: a round roof on a building

name: dread
trans: n. 恐惧；可怕的人（或物）

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: dressing
trans: n. 穿衣；加工；调味品；装饰；梳理
v. 给…穿衣；为…打扮（dress的现在分词）

sentences.english: a vinaigrette dressing
sentences.chinese: 醋油调味料

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿衣；加工；调味品；装饰；梳理
给…穿衣；为…打扮（dress的现在分词）

name: dub
trans: vt. 配音；轻点；打击；授予称号

sentences.english: It was dubbed into Spanish for Mexican audiences.
sentences.chinese: 它已为墨西哥观众配成西班牙语了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配音；轻点；打击；授予称号
detailed_translations.english: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language

sentences.english: The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding skyscrapers.
sentences.chinese: 周围的摩天大楼使得大教堂显得很矮小。

detailed_translations.english: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small
a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.
a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size

name: ego
trans: n. 自我；自负；自我意识

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的
vt. 精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: eminent
trans: adj. 杰出的；有名的；明显的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: endeavour
trans: vt. 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

sentences.english: the enveloping darkness
sentences.chinese: 笼罩四周的黑暗

detailed_translations.english: to cover or wrap something or someone up completely

name: equation
