sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

sentences.english: strict rules of professional etiquette
sentences.chinese: 严格的行规

detailed_translations.english: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: exempt
trans: n. 免税者；被免除义务者
adj. 被免除的；被豁免的

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

name: fracture
trans: n. 破裂，断裂； 骨折

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: galaxy
trans: n. 银河； 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
n. 三星智能手机品牌 2015年三星中国公布Galaxy的中文名称为“盖乐世”（Galaxy）

sentences.english: Astronomers have discovered a distant galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家们发现了一个遥远的星系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
detailed_translations.english: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

name: glamour
trans: n. 魅力，魔力；迷人的美

sentences.english: ...the glamour of show biz.
sentences.chinese: …演艺业的诱惑力。

detailed_translations.english: the attractive and exciting quality of being connected with wealth and success

name: grim
trans: adj. 冷酷的；糟糕的；残忍的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: groan
trans: vi. 呻吟；抱怨；发吱嘎声

sentences.english: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我关掉电视时，孩子们都发出不满的抱怨声。

sentences.english: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
sentences.chinese: 理查德的笑话让你哭笑不得。

detailed_translations.english: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something

sentences.english: Ginny groped for her glasses on the bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 金尼在床头柜上摸着找眼镜。

sentences.english: We groped around in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我们在黑暗中摸索。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

name: herald
trans: n. 预兆，征兆；先驱；传令官；报信者

sentences.english: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
sentences.chinese: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。

sentences.english: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

sentences.english: I welcome the report as a herald of more freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我欢迎这份报告，认为它预示着更多的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon

detailed_translations.chinese: 信使； 预示， 预兆
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a herald of a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear

name: huddle
trans: n. 拥挤；混乱；杂乱一团
vt. 把...挤在一起；使缩成一团；草率了事

sentences.english: We lay huddled together for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 我们紧紧挤在一起取暖。

sentences.english: Off to one side, Sticht, Macomber, Jordan, and Kreps huddled to discuss something.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂希特、麦康伯、乔丹和克雷普斯走到一边，私下商量起事情。

sentences.english: The president has been huddling with his most senior aides.
sentences.chinese: 总统一直在和他的顶级高级助理们秘密地聚到一起进行商谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 聚集在一起，挤作一团；把身子蜷成一团，蜷缩
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
If people huddle in a group, they gather together to discuss something quietly or secretly

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤在一起的人； 一堆杂乱的东西
detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system

sentences.english: The room is kept at 72 degrees and 50% relative humidity.
sentences.chinese: 房间的温度保持在72度，相对湿度50%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of water contained in the air

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: ignite
trans: vt. 点燃；使燃烧；使激动

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: inertia
trans: n.  惯性；惰性，迟钝；不活动

sentences.english: Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 飞机靠惯性着陆。

sentences.english: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

name: insulate
trans: vt. 隔离，使孤立；使绝缘，使隔热

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

name: invert
trans: n. 颠倒的事物；倒置物；倒悬者
vt. 使…转化；使…颠倒；使…反转；使…前后倒置

sentences.english: Invert the cake onto a serving plate.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕倒扣过来放到一个盘子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…转化；使…颠倒；使…反转；使…前后倒置
detailed_translations.english: to put something in the opposite position to the one it was in before, especially by turning it upside down (= the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom )

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠倒的事物；倒置物；倒悬者

name: jack
trans: n. 千斤顶； 插座；男人
vt. 增加；提醒；抬起；用千斤顶顶起某物

sentences.english: a hydraulic jack
sentences.chinese: 液压千斤顶

detailed_translations.chinese: 千斤顶；[电] 插座；男人
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used to lift a heavy weight off the ground, such as a car, and support it while it is in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 增加；提醒；抬起；用千斤顶顶起某物
detailed_translations.english: to lift or push (an object) with a jack
tired or fed up with (something)

name: lavish
trans: adj. 浪费的；丰富的；大方的
vt. 浪费；慷慨给予；滥用

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: lever
trans: vt. 用杠杆撬动；把…作为杠杆

sentences.english: Pull this lever to open the gate.
sentences.chinese: 拉此横杆开启大门。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
to move something with a lever

name: levy
trans: vt. 征收（税等）；征集（兵等）

sentences.english: ...an annual levy on all drivers.
sentences.chinese: …向所有司机征收的年税。

sentences.english: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
sentences.chinese: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

detailed_translations.english: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

name: linger
trans: vi. 徘徊；苟延残喘；磨蹭

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: lofty
trans: adj. 高的；崇高的；高级的；高傲的

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

name: lottery
trans: n. 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法

sentences.english: a lottery ticket
sentences.chinese: 彩票

sentences.english: Do you really think winning the lottery would make you happy?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为彩票中奖会带给你幸福吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法
detailed_translations.english: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: mar
trans: vt. 损毁；损伤；糟蹋；玷污

sentences.english: Their wedding was marred by the death of Jenny’s mother a week earlier.
sentences.chinese: 一周之前珍妮母亲的过世使他们的婚礼蒙上了一层阴影。

sentences.english: A frown marred his handsome features.
sentences.chinese: 紧锁的眉头破坏了他俊美的面容。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less attractive or enjoyable

name: maritime
trans: adj. 海的；海事的；沿海的；海员的

sentences.english: San Francisco has lost nearly all of its maritime industry.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山几乎失去了所有海运业。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海的；海事的；沿海的；海员的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea or ships

sentences.english: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

detailed_translations.english: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

name: mindset
trans: n. 心态；倾向；习惯；精神状态

sentences.english: ‘I feel seasick already,’ she moaned.
sentences.chinese: “我已经开始晕船了。”她抱怨道。

sentences.english: He moaned and groaned all the way there.
sentences.chinese: 他去的一路上抱怨个没完。

sentences.english: Tony moaned in his sleep and then turned over on his side.
sentences.chinese: 托尼在睡梦中呻吟了一下，然后转身侧躺。

detailed_translations.english: to complain in an annoying way, especially in an unhappy voice and without good reason

detailed_translations.chinese: 呻吟声， 呜咽声 A
detailed_translations.english: a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure
If you moan, you make a low sound, usually because you are unhappy or in pain

name: monarch
trans: n. 君主，帝王；最高统治者

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

sentences.english: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.english: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.english: the Prince’s morale-boosting (= intended to raise morale ) mission to the war﹣torn country
sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

sentences.english: It’s time to mow the lawn again.
sentences.chinese: 又该修剪草坪了。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a barn where hay, straw, etc, is stored
to cut grass using a machine

name: mutter
trans: vt. 咕哝；抱怨地说；低声含糊地说

sentences.english: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔茜咕哝了一句什么，我也没有听懂，她就走掉了。

sentences.english: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man,’ Alyssia muttered under her breath .
sentences.chinese: “他真是个讨厌的人。”阿莉西娅轻声嘟囔着。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you

sentences.english: a naive young girl
sentences.chinese: 天真的小女孩

sentences.english: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的； 天真的； 轻信的
detailed_translations.english: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

name: nominal
trans: adj. 名义上的；有名无实的； 票面上的

sentences.english: the nominal head of the rebellion
sentences.chinese: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人

sentences.english: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

detailed_translations.chinese: 名义上的， 有名无实的； 很少的， 象征性的； 名词性的
detailed_translations.english: officially described as being something, when this is not really true

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: offset
trans: n. 抵消，补偿；平版印刷；支管
vt. 抵消；弥补；用平版印刷术印刷

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: oppress
trans: vt. 压迫，压抑；使……烦恼；使……感到沉重

sentences.english: native tribes oppressed by the authorities
sentences.chinese: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫， 压制； 使沉重， 使烦恼
detailed_translations.english: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

name: ordeal
trans: n. 折磨；严酷的考验；痛苦的经验

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

name: overhaul
trans: vt. 分解检查，大修；追上并超过
n. 彻底检修，详细检查

sentences.english: The car needs a complete overhaul.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车需要大修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: necessary changes or repairs made to a machine or system

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: to repair or change the necessary parts in a machine, system etc that is not working correctly

name: overlap
trans: vi. 部分重叠；部分的同时发生
vt. 与…重叠；与…同时发生

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: pant
trans: vi. 喘息；渴望；气喘吁吁地说出某事

sentences.english: He came in panting after running up the steps.
sentences.chinese: 他跑上台阶，气喘吁吁地走了进来。

sentences.english: He was panting for breath .
sentences.chinese: 他上气不接下气。

sentences.english: The dog lay panting on the doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗躺在门阶上喘着气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喘息；渴望；气喘吁吁地说出某事
detailed_translations.english: to breathe quickly with short noisy breaths, for example because you have been running or because it is very hot

name: patron
trans: n. 赞助人；保护人；主顾

sentences.english: a wealthy patron
sentences.chinese: 富有的赞助人

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

name: pending
trans: prep. 在…期间；直到…时为止；在等待…之际
v. 待定；悬而不决（pend的ing形式）
adj. 未决定的；行将发生的

sentences.english: Many trade disputes are pending, awaiting the outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 许多贸易争端悬而未决，等待会谈结果。

detailed_translations.english: not yet decided or settled

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…期间；直到…时为止；在等待…之际
detailed_translations.english: while waiting for something, or until something happens

name: perish
trans: vi. 死亡；毁灭；腐烂；枯萎

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

name: pharmacy
trans: n. 药房；配药学，药剂学；制药业；一批备用药品

sentences.english: an all-night pharmacy
sentences.chinese: 通宵药店

detailed_translations.chinese: 药房；配药学，药剂学；制药业；一批备用药品
detailed_translations.english: a shop or a part of a shop where medicines are prepared and sold

name: plateau
trans: n. （活动或进程中的）稳定阶段，停滞时期

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: prey
trans: n. 捕食；牺牲者；被捕食的动物

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: prop
trans: vt. 支撑，支持，维持；使倚靠在某物上
n. 支柱，支撑物；支持者；道具；（橄榄球中的）支柱前锋

sentences.english: Anna looks after costumes and props.
sentences.chinese: 安娜管理服装和道具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支柱，支撑物；支持者；道具；（橄榄球中的）支柱前锋
detailed_translations.english: an object placed under or against something to hold it in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，支持，维持；使倚靠在某物上
detailed_translations.english: to support something by leaning it against something, or by putting something else under, next to, or behind it

name: prosper
trans: vt. 使……成功；使……昌盛；使……繁荣

sentences.english: His business continued to prosper.
sentences.chinese: 他的生意持续兴隆。

detailed_translations.english: If people or businesses prosper, they are successful and do well

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ； 查询

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: radiate
trans: adj. 辐射状的，有射线的
vi. 辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展
vt. 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播

sentences.english: He radiated calm confidence.
sentences.chinese: 他身上散发着沉稳自信的气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播
detailed_translations.english: if someone radiates a feeling, or if it radiates from them, it is very easy to see that this is how they feel

name: reassure
trans: vt. 使…安心，使消除疑虑

sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

name: reckless
trans: adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的；粗心大意的

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

sentences.english: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面，但损害已经造成了。

detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: renowned
trans: v. 使有声誉（renown的过去分词）

sentences.english: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

detailed_translations.english: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: repress
trans: vt. 抑制；镇压（叛乱等）；约束

sentences.english: He had long ago repressed the painful memories of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他长久压抑着儿时的痛苦记忆。

detailed_translations.english: if someone represses upsetting feelings, memories etc, they do not allow themselves to express or think about them

name: reshuffle
trans: vt. 重新洗牌；改组；重作安排

sentences.english: The prime minister told reporters this morning that he plans to reshuffle his entire cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 首相今晨告诉记者们他计划改组全体内阁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新洗牌；改组；重作安排
detailed_translations.english: When a political leader reshuffles the ministers in a government, he or she changes their jobs so that some of the ministers change their responsibilities
when the jobs of people who work in an organization are changed around, especially in a government

name: restless
trans: adj. 焦躁不安的；不安宁的；得不到满足的

sentences.english: After a few weeks in Marseille, I grew restless and decided to move on.
sentences.chinese: 在马赛住了几星期后，我开始待不住了，决定换个地方。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, especially because you are nervous or bored

name: revolt
trans: vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

name: rig
trans: n. 装备；钻探设备；服装； 帆装
vt. 操纵；装配；装扮；装上索具

sentences.english: The ship was fully rigged and ready to sail.
sentences.chinese: 船已装备就绪，等待起航。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给船装帆;为提供必要装备
detailed_translations.english: to put ropes, sails etc on a ship

name: rigor
trans: n. 严厉；精确；苛刻；僵硬

sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

name: ritual
trans: adj. 仪式的；例行的；礼节性的

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: rot
trans: vt. 使腐烂；使腐朽；使堕落
int. （表示厌恶、蔑视、烦恼等）胡说；糟了

sentences.english: the smell of rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的气味

sentences.english: wood that is soft with rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂变软的木头

detailed_translations.english: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: （表示厌恶、蔑视、烦恼等）胡说；糟了

name: rust
trans: vi. 生锈；成铁锈色；变迟钝

sentences.english: There were large patches of rust on the car.
sentences.chinese: 车上有大片锈斑。

sentences.english: The metal had begun to rust.
sentences.chinese: 金属开始生锈。

detailed_translations.english: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet
to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: safeguard
trans: n.  保护；保卫；保护措施

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: salmon
trans: n. 鲑鱼；大马哈鱼；鲑肉色；鲑鱼肉；橙红色，粉橙色

sentences.english: The salmon was brought to the table whole, garnished with parsley and slices of tomato and cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

sentences.english: State authorities have ordered cutbacks in deliveries of water from the delta because of the threat to endangered species of salmon and smelt.
sentences.chinese: 由于鲑鱼和胡瓜鱼这些濒危物种受到威胁，国家当局已经要求消减从该三角洲往外输水的量。

detailed_translations.english: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs

name: salvage
trans: n. 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金

sentences.english: a massive salvage operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抢救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金
detailed_translations.english: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

name: scrape
trans: n. 刮掉；擦痕；困境；刮擦声

sentences.english: Scrape the carrots and slice them thinly.
sentences.chinese: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

sentences.english: The two of them scraped their dishes clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

sentences.english: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

sentences.english: the scrape of iron on stone
sentences.chinese: 铁摩擦石头发出的嚓嚓声

sentences.english: She emerged from the overturned car with only a few scrapes and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc
the action of one thing rubbing roughly against another

name: scrutiny
trans: n. 详细审查；监视；细看；选票复查

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

sentences.english: Sharks were circling around our boat.
sentences.chinese: 鲨鱼在我们的小船周围游弋。

sentences.english: Beware the sharks when you are making up your mind how to invest.
sentences.chinese: 当你决定如何投资时要提防诈骗者。

detailed_translations.english: a large sea fish with several rows of very sharp teeth that is considered to be dangerous to humans

name: shepherd
trans: n. 牧羊人；牧师；指导者
vt. 牧羊；带领；指导；看管

sentences.english: The shepherd tended a flock.
sentences.chinese: 这个牧羊人照管羊群。

sentences.english: The chevalier might boast with reason to the friends who visited him that few retired captains were more snugly quartered than he in his crib in shepherd's inn.
sentences.chinese: 骑士完全有理由向前来拜访的朋友夸口，说他在牧羊人会馆的住所是他的安乐窝，退伍的上尉能象他这么逍遥自在的不多。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to take care of sheep
to lead or guide a group of people somewhere, making sure that they go where you want them to go

name: showcase
trans: n. 陈列橱， 陈列柜；显示优点的东西
vt. 使展现；在玻璃橱窗陈列

sentences.english: Restored films are being showcased this month at a festival in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 本月的巴黎电影节将展映一些修复版的电影。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈列橱，[家具] 陈列柜；显示优点的东西
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that is designed to show the good qualities of a person, organization, product etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使展现；在玻璃橱窗陈列
detailed_translations.english: If something is showcased, it is displayed or presented to its best advantage

name: shred
trans: n. 碎片；少量剩余；最少量；破布
vt. 切成条状；用碎纸机撕毁

sentences.english: Cut the cabbage into fine long shreds.
sentences.chinese: 把这棵卷心菜切成细长条。

detailed_translations.english: a small thin piece that is torn or cut roughly from something
to cut or tear something into small thin pieces

name: sniff
trans: n. 吸，闻；嗤之以鼻；气味；以鼻吸气；吸气声

sentences.english: Margaret sniffed miserably and nodded.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特可怜地抽泣着点了点头。

sentences.english: Stop sniffing and blow your nose.
sentences.chinese: 别抽鼻子了，擤一擤鼻涕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 以鼻吸气，用力吸入；嗅，闻
detailed_translations.english: to breathe air into your nose noisily, for example when you are crying or have a cold

name: sodium
trans: n.  钠（11号元素，符号 Na）

sentences.english: ...one level teaspoon of sodium bicarbonate powder.
sentences.chinese: 一平茶匙碳酸氢钠粉末

detailed_translations.english: a common silver-white metal that usually exists in combination with other substances, for example in salt. It is a chemical element: symbol Na

name: solicit
trans: vt. 征求；招揽；请求；乞求
vi. 征求；招揽；恳求；请求

sentences.english: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
sentences.chinese: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for money, help, or information

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

name: sprawl
trans: n. 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势
vt. 懒散地伸开；使蔓生
vi. 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: stagger
trans: vt. 蹒跚；使交错；使犹豫

sentences.english: He managed to stagger home.
sentences.chinese: 他好不容易才蹒跚着走回家。

sentences.english: She staggered back a step.
sentences.chinese: 她踉跄着后退了一步。

sentences.english: The old man staggered drunkenly to his feet.
sentences.chinese: 老汉醉醺醺地踉跄着站了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
to make someone feel very surprised or shocked
an unsteady movement of someone who is having difficulty in walking

name: stalk
trans: n. （植物的）茎，秆；（支持叶子、果实和花的）梗，柄；追踪；高视阔步
vt. 追踪，潜近；高视阔步
vi. 高视阔步地走；潜近，偷偷接近

sentences.english: celery stalks
sentences.chinese: 芹菜茎

detailed_translations.english: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them

name: stark
trans: adj. 完全的；荒凉的；刻板的；光秃秃的；朴实的
adv. 完全；明显地；突出地；质朴地

sentences.english: In the cold dawn light, the castle looked stark and forbidding.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷的曙光中，城堡看上去了无生气，令人生畏。

sentences.english: the stark beauty of New Mexico
sentences.chinese: 新墨西哥州的荒凉之美

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的；荒凉的；刻板的；光秃秃的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: very plain in appearance, with little or no colour or decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全；明显地；突出地；质朴地
detailed_translations.english: completely crazy

detailed_translations.chinese: (Stark)人名；(俄、罗)斯塔尔克；(英、芬、法、瑞典)斯塔克；(德)施塔克

name: strand
trans: vt. 使搁浅；使陷于困境；弄断；使落后

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

name: stumble
trans: vi. 踌躇，蹒跚；失足；犯错

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun

name: submerge
trans: vi. 淹没；潜入水中；湮没

sentences.english: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯埋头工作，试图忘记汤姆。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it

name: subordinate
trans: n. 下属，下级；部属，属下

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: swamp
trans: vt. 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
vi. 下沉；陷入沼泽；陷入困境；不知所措（过去式swamped，过去分词swamped，现在分词swamping，第三人称单数swamps，名词swampiness，形容词swampy）

sentences.english: I spent one whole night by a swamp behind the road listening to frogs.
sentences.chinese: 我整个晚上都在这条路后面的一个沼泽地旁听蛙鸣。

sentences.english: Their electronic navigation failed and a rogue wave swamped the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他们的电子导航装置失灵了，一个巨浪吞没了那只船。

detailed_translations.english: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

detailed_translations.chinese: 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
detailed_translations.english: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

name: tack
trans: n. 大头钉；粗缝；行动方针；食物
vt. 附加；以大头针钉住
vi. 抢风航行；作文字形移动

sentences.english: ...a box of carpet tacks.
sentences.chinese: …一盒地毯钉。

sentences.english: A handwritten note was tacked to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 一张手写便条钉在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: a small nail with a sharp point and a flat top
to attach something to a wall, board etc, using a tack

name: tan
trans: n. （日晒后皮肤的）黝黑色；棕褐色；鞣料；马戏团

sentences.english: I wish I could get a tan like that.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我也能晒成那样的棕褐色肤色。

detailed_translations.chinese: （日晒后皮肤的）黝黑色；棕褐色；鞣料；马戏团
detailed_translations.english: the attractive brown colour that someone with pale skin gets after they have been in the sun
if you tan, or if the sun tans you, your skin becomes darker because you spend time in the sun
having a light yellowish-brown colour

name: tease
trans: vt. 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
n. 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: tenant
trans: n. 承租人；房客；佃户；居住者
vt. 租借（常用于被动语态）

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: thermal
trans: adj. 热的；热量的；保热的

sentences.english: thermal energy
sentences.chinese: 热能

detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by heat
a rising current of warm air used by birds

name: thrift
trans: n. 节俭；节约； 海石竹

sentences.english: They were rightly praised for their thrift and enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 他们因勤俭节约和开创精神而受到了应得的表扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭；节约；[植] 海石竹
detailed_translations.english: wise and careful use of money, so that none is wasted

name: trauma
trans: n.  创伤（由心理创伤造成精神上的异常）；外伤

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

name: trickle
trans: vt. 使…滴；使…淌；使…细细地流
vi. 滴；细细地流；慢慢地移动

sentences.english: A tear trickled down the old man's cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一滴泪水顺着老人的面颊流了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴；细细地流；慢慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
a thin slow flow of liquid

sentences.english: Pete was trimming the lawn around the roses.
sentences.chinese: 皮特在修剪玫瑰丛周围的草坪。

sentences.english: I have my hair trimmed every six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 我每六周剪一次头发。

detailed_translations.english: to make something look neater by cutting small pieces off it
when something is cut to make it look neater
neat and well cared for

name: trophy
trans: n. 奖品；战利品；纪念品
adj. 显示身份的；有威望的

sentences.english: A lion’s head was among the trophies of his African trip.
sentences.chinese: 他非洲之行的战利品之一是个狮头。

detailed_translations.english: something that you keep to prove your success in something, especially in war or hunting

name: tub
trans: vt. 把…装入桶；为…洗盆浴
vi. 洗盆浴；（衣服等）被放在桶里洗

sentences.english: I had a long soak in the tub.
sentences.chinese: 我在浴缸里泡了很久。

detailed_translations.english: a large container in which you sit to wash yourself

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗盆浴；（衣服等）被放在桶里洗

name: ultra
trans: n. 极端主义者；过激论者；急进论者

sentences.english: She unfolded her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她张开双臂。

sentences.english: As the story unfolds, we learn more about Max’s childhood.
sentences.chinese: 随着故事的展开，我们对马克斯的童年有了更多的了解。

detailed_translations.english: to spread open or flat sth that has previously been folded; to become open and flat

name: uphold
trans: vt. 支撑；鼓励；赞成；举起

sentences.english: We have a duty to uphold the law.
sentences.chinese: 维护法律是我们的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

sentences.english: Dogs must be vaccinated against distemper.
sentences.chinese: 犬类必须接种疫苗以防犬热病。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person or animal from a disease by giving them a vaccine

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: vent
trans: n. （感情的）发泄；出口；通风孔
vt. 发泄感情；放出…；给…开孔
vi. 放出；（通过排泄等）减轻压力

sentences.english: a blocked air vent
sentences.chinese: 堵塞的通风口

sentences.english: a volcanic vent
sentences.chinese: 火山口

detailed_translations.english: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

name: versatile
trans: adj. 多才多艺的；通用的，万能的；多面手的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: vice
trans: n. 恶习；缺点； 老虎钳；卖淫

sentences.english: Smoking is my only vice.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是我唯一的恶习。

detailed_translations.english: a bad habit

name: vicious
trans: adj. 恶毒的；恶意的；堕落的；有错误的；品性不端的；剧烈的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

name: whereby
trans: adv. 凭借；通过…；借以；与…一致

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: wither
trans: vt. 使凋谢；使畏缩；使衰弱

sentences.english: The flowers in Isabel's room had withered.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔房间里的花朵已经枯萎了。

detailed_translations.english: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die

name: yearn
trans: vi. 渴望，向往；思念，想念；怀念；同情，怜悯

sentences.english: He yearned for freedom.
sentences.chinese: 他曾渴望自由。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

name: zip
trans: n. 拉链; 精力，活力; 尖啸声; 一种程序压缩格式
vt. 给予…速度; 用拉链拉上或扣上
vt.& vi. 尖啸而过; （使沿某方向）快速移动

sentences.english: The zip on my skirt had broken.
sentences.chinese: 我裙子上的拉链坏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拉链；活力，精力；尖啸声，撕裂声；一种程序压缩的档案文件格式
detailed_translations.english: two lines of small metal or plastic pieces that slide together to fasten a piece of clothing

detailed_translations.chinese: 拉开或拉上；以尖啸声行进
detailed_translations.english: to fasten something using a zip
